Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About the Job

We're looking for a motivated Data Engineer (m/f/d) to join our Data & Analytics team and support its Data strategies.

In your day-to-day work, you'll focus on building data-driven applications and get the opportunity to contribute to various projects.

Our Data and Analytics team enables our portfolio companies and external partners to grow sustainably as they shift from intuitive to objective decision-making through reliable data collection, proper data infrastructure implementation, and effective data initiatives.

We firmly believe that the decade of data has begun: Powerful technologies are readily accessible to turn raw data into real insights, products, features and more. We are looking for capable talents from various backgrounds to tag along on our journey to utilise data to create real impact via scalable Data / ML infrastructure, thorough analyses & meaningful relationships to ensure proper application.

In this role, you'll:


Build high-quality data warehouses, marketing automations, recommendation engines, etc.
Integrate data from various systems into flexible and consistent representations
Explore and evaluate the lasting impact of AI use cases and their implementation
Ensure that all people and IT systems in the organisation have easy access to data, through various front-ends and interfaces
Work in an agile software development process and collaborate closely with the Analytics team
Impact the business while working in an amazing cross-functional team environment


Your Profile


Genuine interest in data and algorithms, and an excitement for solving difficult business problems through scalable data products
Knowledge of version control systems, web technologies, software engineering best practices, and the inner workings of database systems
The ability to turn data science into something that creates business value - is a plus
Desire to learn new things (we know you can "fly at least one type of plane", and we will provide you with many types and variations of said plane)
Good communication skills in English (native/full working proficiency)
A degree in computer science or a comparable qualification


Please note that we're looking for support in our Berlin office. Eligibility to work in the EU is required.

Benefits and Perks:


Remote-friendly – Work anywhere in Germany or take advantage of our beautiful and well-equipped office at the heart of Berlin
Choose your tech – Macbook/Windows/Linux laptop and optional screen.
Career growth – Access to internal workshops, knowledge-sharing meetups, PAV Academy professional training opportunities, industry conferences, and other personal development possibilities
Subsidised products and services, including meal vouchers, German language classes, a bike leasing program, and discounts on services of our portfolio companies and various other brands
Wellness – 24/7 access to counseling specialists, free subscription to workplace wellbeing platform Unmind, weekly online yoga classes
Paid team and company events
Social activities – Hang out with co-workers during and after-hours (Slack or IRL, you decide), grab lunch or coffee with randomly assigned teammates, and disconnect from everything to spend quality time in outdoor activities
Visa application support and relocation package


Apply below and become a part of our success story!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Project A is committed to diverse and equal opportunities hiring for all – applicants, candidates, and employees alike. We value humans – with all our glorious multifaceted backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences – and look forward to your application.

Title: Junior Data Visualization Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Aufgaben


Als Junior Data Visualization Engineer (m/w/d) übernimmst du mit deinem Team die Konzeption und Umsetzung von Reporting-Projekten
Dein Fokus liegt auf der Erstellung von Reporting-Lösungen nach Kundenanforderung
Die dazugehörigen Datenanalysen sowie deren Reports & Dashboards liegen in deiner Verantwortung
Aufbau und Pflege von Datenstrecken, Datenmodellen und BI-Reportings, sowie deren Weiterentwicklung on-premise oder in der Cloud, gehören zu deinem Alltag
Mit Hilfe von professionellem Projektmanagement setzt du die Anforderungen des Kunden in qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse um



Benefits


Immer up to date: Jede Menge externe und interne Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Zertifizierungen
Coole Offices: Standorte bundesweit, interdisziplinär organisiert. Sie vereinen das Know-how verschiedener Einheiten der Reply Gruppe
Onboarding-Event: Vom ersten Tag an bist du Teil unseres Netzwerkes und profitierst vom Know-how der Reply-Community
Cluster Reply Spirit: Starkes Teamgefühl, flache Hierarchien und ein persönliches, familiäres und wertschätzendes Miteinander



Qualifikationen


Wir freuen uns auf dein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches/ naturwissenschaftliches Studium
Du bringst grundlegende Kenntnisse und idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrung in den Bereichen Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence mit
Erste Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL, DAX / MDX, Python oder R sowie Azure und in der Erstellung von Dashboards mittels BI-Frontends bzw. Power BI sind von Vorteil
Die Gewinnung von Informationen aus sehr großen Datenmengen begeistert dich
Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse und zeichnest dich durch eine analytische, präzise und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus



Join a leading team of Microsoft specialists.

Cluster Reply ist das Unternehmen der Reply-Gruppe, das sich auf die Beratung und Systemintegration von Microsoft-Technologien spezialisiert hat. Cluster Reply unterstützt seine Kunden bei der Systemintegration von Anwendungen & Infrastruktur, Business Applikationen, Modern Workplace, IoT, Big Data und Artificial Intelligence. Cluster Reply ist in Deutschland tätig und arbeitet mit anderen Unternehmen der Reply-Gruppe zusammen, die Microsoft-Partner in Brasilien, Italien, Großbritannien und den USA sind.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing/Measurement
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will be focusing mostly around helping improve and creating measurement tools to determine the ROI of our performance marketing campaigns.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Previous experience in marketing attribution and customer lifetime value


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
We are one of the fastest growing podcast & audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an ambitious Analytics Engineer to join our Data team and play a key role in delivering exceptional data solutions to individuals and teams across the organization.

Come and join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.




This is the role

At Podimo, data is at the center of nearly everything we do; guiding decisions and fueling our business processes. This is where you come in!

In this position, you will join our BI & Analytics Engineering team, which is part of our global Data department. The team is responsible for developing and maintaining our company-wide data platform and works to enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.

You will be at the heart of the collaboration between data analysts, scientists, engineers, and business teams, and will be responsible for bringing efficient and robust data models, BI interfaces, and self-service solutions to life.

Our team offers a casual atmosphere with excellent opportunities for growth and impact, and you will in this position get the chance to play a key role in shaping and developing Podimo’s data modeling and BI efforts.



Your main responsibilities are:

Work closely with data analysts, business teams, and data scientists to understand their needs and translate those into effective data solutions
Utilize dbt, SQL, BigQuery, and Looker/LookML to transform and model both new and existing data sources
Develop and maintain dashboards, visualizations, and self-service tools that enable business stakeholders to gain insights and make data-driven decisions
Provide data modeling expertise to team and department members through code reviews and pairing to help deliver optimal and scalable designs and queries
Promote the adoption of data solutions and interfaces by educating business users and data developers on their usage




This is you

We are looking for a colleague who gets a kick out of and takes pride in building awesome data solutions. You understand the concepts of working in a dynamic and fast-paced startup environment, and you thrive in collaborating cross-functionally with your colleagues across the company.



In more detail, you will thrive in this role if you have:
Some experience working with BI or analytics engineering 
Proficiency in data modeling and knowledge of data warehousing principles
Strong experience with dbt, SQL, BigQuery, and data visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
A love for teamwork, continuous improvement, and learning
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Previous experience with finance and/or product analytics (a strong plus, but not a requirement)

Naturally, being passionate about podcasts, audio content, and entertainment is a big plus!


These are the benefits
ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) for all employees, no matter where in the world you live.
Learning and personal development opportunities to help you thrive and enrich your skills in a fast-paced creator economy.
Up to six months of fully paid parental leave for all new parents - no matter how you identify or where in the world you live
Free online therapy sessions through We.Care.
Delicious lunch with great colleagues.
Unlimited child sick days and the opportunity to work flexible hours and remotely.
Opportunity to make an impact at a growing international company and see your work pay off immediately.

This is the hiring process

Please share your CV or LinkedIn profile. We’d love to hear why you’re interested in the job, but it’s not a must. If we move forward with your application, here’s what to expect:

An initial conversation with a recruiter to set expectations
A case conversation with the hiring manager, Martin Otto-Sidelmann, Director of BI & Analytics Engineering
A coffee chat with the Chief Data Officer and some of your potential future team members

We might tweak the process to keep things smooth and enjoyable. We'll be conducting interviews continuously, aiming for a start date around August or asap after that date.

Can’t wait to hear from you!




This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about discovering, creating, and obsessing over great stories. We support our creators deeply, and have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their most exciting ideas and stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we have a good time doing it.

We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world we’re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.


Equal Opportunity Employer

Podimo is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe in equal opportunities for all in our workplace. We don’t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age or political orientation, no matter where we operate.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
As a Data Engineer at Intapp, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines and data loaders, as well as scraping data from various sources. You will ensure the quality, integrity, and availability of our data, which is essential for our data-driven decision-making processes.

What you will do:




Develop, deploy, and maintain web scraping tools to gather data from targeted websites efficiently and reliably.


Design and implement data scraping architectures that are scalable and robust.


Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to ingest and process large volumes of data from diverse sources.


Build and optimize data loaders to ensure seamless data integration and transformation.


Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions.


Implement and maintain data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.


Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.


Stay up-to-date with industry best practices in web scraping, data analytics, and data privacy regulations.



What you will need:




Strong programming skills in Python.


Experience in building and deploying web scrapers using tools like Scrapy, Beautiful Soup, XPath, etc.


Knowledge of parallel and distributed programming including load balancing, scalability, and concurrency


Familiarity with data storage technologies like databases (SQL, NoSQL) and data formats (JSON, CSV, etc.)


Problem-solving skills and attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in scraped data.


Strong communication skills to effectively convey findings and collaborate with team members.



Bonus if you have:




Experience with data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy).


Solid analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex datasets and extract actionable insights.


Familiarity with Azure and their data services.


Knowledge of data governance and data security best practices.


Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).



What you will get:

In return for your passion, commitment, and collaborative approach, we offer:




Competitive base salary plus variable compensation and equity


A flexible work environment


Generous paid parental leave, including adoptive leave


Traditional comprehensive benefits, plus:



Flexible Paid Time Off


Family Formation benefit offered by Carrot


Wellness programs and benefits provided by Modern Health


Paid volunteer time off and donation matching for the causes you care about


Opportunities for personal growth and professional development supported by a community of talented professionals


An open, collaborative environment where your background and contributions are valued


Experience at a growing public company where you can make an impact and achieve your goals


Open offices and break areas stocked with beverages and snacks


Intapp provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and will make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks if applicable to the position.

Please note: Intapp will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone. We will never extend a job offer unless you have been contacted directly by an Intapp recruiter and have participated in the interview process which will generally consist of 3 or more virtual or in person meetings. Please note that Intapp only uses company email addresses, which contain “@intapp.com” or “@dealcloud.com” to communicate with candidates via email. Intapp will never ask for financial information of any kind or for any payment during the job application process. We post all legitimate job openings on the Intapp Career Site at https://www.intapp.com/working-at-intapp/. If you believe you were a victim of such a scam, you may contact your local authorities. Intapp is not responsible for any claims, losses, damages, or expenses resulting from scammers.

Title: Senior Data Analytics Expert
Description:
Our client is internationally recognised manufacturer of cardio- and endovascular implants. As a globally active company headquartered in Berlin, they develop, produce and distribute high-quality medical products based on the latest research and technology. Their success is based on the competence and result-oriented cooperation of our employees.

The Corporate IT Services division plans, creates and operates IT for the global corporate group.




Your tasks




Conception and development of powerful data platform solutions including the underlying cloud infrastructure (Snowflake, AWS) for use in BI applications and data science projects
Connecting new data sources and interfaces with modern ETL tools and providing the data for our self-service platform
Development of high-performance data pipelines (streaming and batch) with Amazon Cloud
Advice on the feasibility of implementing requirements into efficient BI solution concepts
Planning and implementation of projects for BI and data analytics solutions
Modelling and implementation of dimensional data models
Design, creation and optimization of ETL/ELT processes
New and further development of dashboards & reports as well as advice on the use of BI and analytics applications




Your profile




Completed studies in computer science, data science or comparable
Several years of experience in BI & Analytics in-house or relevant experience in consulting
Experience in agile project management and agile methods
Familiar with BI and analytics projects from requirements analysis to acceptance
In-depth experience in data engineering (ETL processes, cloud
Computing (including AWS, Snowflake), data analytics (SQL) and reporting (QlikSense, PowerBI)
Proficient in German and English




What we offer




Permanent employment and attractive collective wage agreement (IG Metall)
Mobile working and flexible working hours – we always try to achieve the best work-life balance
Solid onboarding including mentoring program
Continuous learning and training opportunities
Health promotion such as vaccination campaigns, anti-stress offers, company medical and other support services
Food allowance and vegan food options in our on-site canteens
IG Metall collective agreement benefits such as 30 days holiday + additional holiday days options
Full-time according to collective agreement with a 35 hours/week
Corporate benefits such as sports activities and shopping discounts
Employer-funded pension
Job ticket subsidy




If this positions is interesting or you would like to find out more, please be sure to reach out.

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
Freelance Data Engineer

Job - Data Engineer

Client Location - Berlin or Remote

Client Industry - E-commerce

Contract Length - Until 31/12/24 with planned extension into 2025

Project focus

Support a multi-brand company with migrating each brand's data pipelines to one common data platform and onboard their engineers onto the pipelines.

Manage and improve data pipelines.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to understand data sources.
Coordinate with Central teams on data contracts and platform requirements.
Ensure data quality and governance.
Train internal staff to maintain and update pipelines after the project.





Key skills and Experience required

Experience with data orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Python)
Experience with big data NoSQL databases (e.g., S3, Databricks)
Knowledge of data file formats (e.g., Delta, Iceberg)
Experience with AWS or other cloud platforms
Proficient in shell scripting and configuration (e.g., YAML)
Understanding of Software Development and Agile practices
Familiar with Git, PR reviews, CI systems, and Continuous Delivery

If this role is of interest, please send an up to date CV to alex.hevey@darwinrecruitment.com

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It’s Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience


#STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #Bengaluru #SãoPaulo #Delhi #NewYorkCity #Nigeria #London #Hyderabad #Pune #Mumbai #Colombia #Paris #Jakarta #Chennai #SanFrancisco #WashingtonDC #Toronto #Pakistan #LosAngeles #Dallas #Chicago #Kenya #Boston #Shanghai #Egypt #BuenosAires #Manila #Netherlands #Singapore #RiodeJaneiro #Beijing #Atlanta #Sydney #Madrid #Vietnam #SaudiArabia #Peru #Melbourne #Ireland #Russia #Bangladesh #MexicoCity #Philadelphia #Chile #SeattleArea #Noida #Kolkata #Guangdong #UnitedArabEmirates #TelAvivDistrict #Houston #KualaLumpur #BeloHorizonte #SouthKorea #Bangkok #Istanbul #Austin #Curitiba #Warsaw #Campinas #Barcelona #Ukraine #CostaRica #Berlin #Romania #Denver #Johannesburg #Minneapolis #Manchester #Miami #MexicoCity #Phoenix #Detroit #Coimbatore #Milan #PortoAlegre #Vancouver #Montreal #Charlotte #SanDiego #Ghana #SaltLakeCity #Raleigh #HongKong #Fortaleza #Munich #Prague #Ecuador #TampaBay #Tokyo #Serbia #Taipei #Cracow #Zhejiang #CapeTown #Brasilia #Columbus data representation data analysis SQL data analytics analytics python (programming language) data mining data science r (programming language) tableau analytical skills data visualization databases business analysis business intelligence (bi) microsoft sql server machine learning statistics microsoft power bi java finance shopee traveloka google facebook ctrip trip.com makemytrip grab amazon pandas (software) artificial intelligence (ai) information technology capital one accenture upwork deloitte mckinsey bain microsoft uber lyft gojek lazada alibaba shopify expedia skyscanner

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.


Show more
HTML:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

  • Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
  • Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
  • Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English
  • Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
  • Good numerical reasoning skills
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It’s Great if you Have:

  • Experience in digital marketing
  • Academic research experience

Title: Database Developer (a) @ regiocom
Description:
Wir arbeiten im direkten Auftrag der RegioCom SE und verrechnen keine Vermittlungsgebühr.

Was diese Position zu bieten hat:

🎨 Bedeutungsvolle Arbeit mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum

📚 Fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

⏰ Flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten und familienfreundliche Arbeitszeiten

🅿️ Kostenfreie Parkplätze & finanziellen Zuschuss für ÖPNV

Interessiert? Dann buche jetzt einen Call mit uns! 📞

,

Für unseren Kunden regiocom suchen wir per sofort: Datenbanken Entwickler (w/m/d) .

Job-Zusammenfassung

Du bist ein Allrounder in der Datenbankentwicklung und möchtest Deine Technologiekompetenz stetig weiterentwickeln? Dann aufgepasst! 👨‍💻🔧

Als Recruiting-Partner von regiocom SE suchen wir genau Dich als Datenbanken Entwickler (w/m/d) für Datenbanken zur Verstärkung ihres Softwareentwicklungs-Teams. In dieser Position arbeitest Du an verschiedenen Projekten, analysierst bestehende Systeme und unterstützt die Kollegenschaft bei technischen Fragestellungen. Freue Dich auf eine individuelle Einarbeitung und flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten. Außerdem erhältst Du attraktive Mitarbeitervorteile und spannende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. 💼💻💪

#Datenbankentwicklung #Softwareentwicklung #Technologiekompetenz #Allrounder #Weiterentwicklung #Flexibilität #Mitarbeitervorteile #Karrierechance #JobOpportunity

Was Du tun wirst


Entwicklung, Test, Dokumentation und Produktivsetzung von Softwaremodulen
Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von Anforderungsspezifikationen und Pflichtenheften sowie Projektplanung in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Projektmanagement
Fachliche Mitarbeit in Projekten unter Berücksichtigung der Projektvorgaben (z.B. Kosten, Termine, Qualität)
Analyse bestehender Applikationen/Systeme
Anpassung von Applikationen entsprechend Änderungsanforderungen
Bearbeitung von Störungsmeldungen im 2nd-/3rd-Level Support und ggf. deren Koordination
Durchführung von Tests im Rahmen der Qualitätssicherung
Selbständige Aktualisierung der eigenen Technologiekompetenz



Was Dich für den Job auszeichnet


(Fach-) Hochschulstudium (Informatik, technisch, naturwissenschaftlich) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung in der IT (Fachinformatiker für Anwendungsentwicklung)
Mehrjährige Erfahrungen in der Datenbankentwicklung
Programmiersprache: PL/SQL
Datenbank-System: Oracle
Teamplayer mit ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Ge: C1 – Fachkundige Sprachkenntnisse



Nice to Have


En: B1 – Fortgeschrittene Sprachverwendung



Team


Berichterstattung an: Projektmanager
Kolleg*innen: 14



Benefits


Zahlreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Moderne & barrierefreier Arbeitsplatz
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle
Jobticket und Zuschuss für ÖPNV
Regelmäßige Augenuntersuchungen, Grippeschutzimpfungen & Massagen
Wasser, Tee und frisches Obst
Kostenlose Sportangebote
Kantine mit frischen Mahlzeiten
Teamveranstaltungen
Werbeprämie für Empfehlungen, neuer Kollegen
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge & Gruppenunfallversicherung



,

Dich erwartet ein sympathisches Team bestehend aus ca. 14 Mitarbeitenden, welche sich stets gegenseitig unterstützen und einen sehr offenen, freundschaftlichen Umgang pflegen. Die Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt von flachen Hierarchien, direkter Kommunikation und Transparenz auf jeglichen Ebenen. Du erhältst reichlich Freiraum zur individuellen Entwicklung, sowohl fachlich als auch persönlich, in einer Atmosphäre, die keinen Platz für Ellenbogenmentalität lässt.

,

Arbeiten bei regiocom ist abwechslungsreich und zukunftsorientiert

Arbeiten bei regiocom das ist oft mehr als nur ein Job. Egal, wo du deinen Platz findest in der Unternehmensgruppe, du bist immer Teil eines Teams, das täglich im Einsatz ist um Kunden zu helfen. Ob als IT-Admin oder Entwickler, als Projektmanager, Jurist, Trainer oder im Telefonservice,

Innovativ, eigentümergeführt und verantwortungsbewusst

Das Alleinstellungsmerkmal für Auftraggeber ist die Verlässlichkeit von regiocom. Seit über 25 Jahren am Markt, hat das Unternehmen mit seinem Service und Innovationen Meilensteine gesetzt. Immer mit dem Ziel, dass Kunden erfolgreich sind. Beleg dafür sind die langjährigen Geschäftsbeziehungen zu den Auftraggebern.

Aus dem Drei-Mann-Unternehmen ist ein renommierter Service-Konzern geworden, mit über 5000 Mitarbeitern an 22 Standorten zwischen dem Schwarzen Meer und der Nordsee. Die drei Gründer prägen mit ihrer Einstellung und ihrer Erfahrung das Geschäft. regiocom ist heute der größte inhabergeführte Full-Service-Provider in Deutschland.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics (Supply Acquisition)
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Selection and Sales Ops teams, focusing on uncovering opportunities and influencing the supply acquisition strategy of GetYourGuide.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity
Experience in statistical modelling


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Experience Analytics (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


You will join the Customer Experience Analytics team. Our main goal is to delve deep into the customer experience, revealing its hidden elements. We are part of the customer care organisation, putting us in a unique position to understand and detect customer issues better and faster than any other team. We empower various teams across the entire organisation to tackle the hidden opportunities that we discover, ensuring a continuously improving experience for our customers. In this role, you will be instrumental in enhancing the CX insight platform, a pivotal asset that will be utilised to decode and enhance the customer experience comprehensively. Your contributions will not only shape our data landscape but also directly influence our ability to understand and elevate every customer interaction.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups


WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED




Data Analysis and Insights Generation Utilize advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from large and complex datasets. Translate these insights into actionable recommendations to drive business growth and optimization.
Statistical Analysis Apply advanced statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and relationships within data. Conduct hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and other statistical techniques to support data-driven decision-making.
Data Visualization and Reporting Develop visually compelling dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends to stakeholders. Ensure that data visualisations are intuitive, informative, and tailored to the needs of different audience groups.
ETL Process Optimization Design and optimise ETL pipelines, ensuring data integrity and reliability throughout the data lifecycle.
Self-Service Analytics Enablement Develop self-service analytics tools and resources to empower stakeholders to access and analyse data independently. Provide training and support to enable users to leverage data effectively in their decision-making processes
Continuous Learning and Innovation Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in data analytics. Proactively identify opportunities to innovate and enhance our analytical capabilities. Share knowledge and best practices with team members to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a solid understanding of statistical principles and their application in data analysis.
You have strong expertise in SQL and Python. You have experience building and optimising data pipelines, as well as applying data modelling techniques to design datasets for Business Intelligence systems. You are familiar with Databricks Spark, AWS.
You are familiar with causal inference methods and their application in data analysis.
You are adept at tackling complex data challenges, possess strong analytical skills, and can devise efficient, scalable solutions.
You are experienced with data visualization tools.
You understand the importance of data quality and the implications that issues in data quality can trigger in other teams. At the same time, you understand the tradeoff between complexity and practicality and know when to favor one over the other in your solutions.
You excel in a collaborative environment, can articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and enjoy working in cross-functional teams.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review.

Show more

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
  • 2 paid volunteering days a year
  • Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start
  • Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
  • Family services, including counselling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching available
  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
DocMorris is a fully-owned subsidiary of the DocMorris AG of Switzerland, which generated revenue of EUR 1.081,6 million in the Germany segment in 2022 and currently has 10 million active customers. The platform covers all activities related to holistic digital healthcare provision, from diagnosis with an online doctor to pharmaceutical advice and the medication, healthcare product or digital solution required.

The DocMorris healthcare platform is the market leader in online pharmacies and the leading provider of health tech solutions in the prescription process and telemedicine. DocMorris gives customers easy access to all healthcare services in one place.

As a Junior Data Engineer, you analyze a wide range of business problems, optimize data ingestion and integration processes and make an important contribution to the development of new business models in the eCommerce and healthcare environment. You will work in an agile, cross-functional product team and directly interact with stakeholders from different functional and technical teams, while also enjoying the support and training of senior colleagues and mentors from your first day in the company.




Tasks

Analyze a wide range of business problems, optimize processes and make an important contribution to the development of new business models in the eCommerce and healthcare environment
Support the work of other Data Engineers and coordinate cross functionally with diverse teams.
Work on our analytical platform based on Snowflake, dbt, Tableau, AWS, and other technologies
Develop and operate data pipelines, model data in the warehouse using SQL/dbt and create complex data products in Python.




Strengths

A completed technical or scientific degree or comparable training; 1-2 years of practical experience in either internships or a previous role is desirable
Intermediate SQL Skills
Profound knowledge in at least one of the two following areas:
Data Storage and Transformation (e.g. Snowflake, dbt)
Programming and Pipelines (e.g. Python, Advanced SQL, Cloud Computation)
Great understanding of customer needs and strong analytical and communication skills
Agile and effective mindset, fast learner, independence and hands-on mentality
Fluent English




What Do We Offer

Mentoring and training, as well as regular feedback and structured introduction/learning-on-the-job
High share of mobile working and flexible working time
Quarterly on-site-events in international locations
Respectful and supportive working environment with a lot of room for own ideas and initiatives
One of the most modern tech-stacks for BI and data integration that exists!




Work and live at DocMorris

At DocMorris we have created an environment that focuses on teamwork. Our employees combine passion and fun at work with drive, initiative and entrepreneurial spirit. This is how we achieve outstanding results together.

We want to create the healthiest possible working environment in which all employees feel comfortable and can develop their skills. We offer a variety of initiatives to enable a work-life balance, including flexible working hours, part-time work and the option of remote working. Our benefits include company retirement plans, disability insurance, travel reimbursement, discounted employee stock, and more.

Join our team and actively contribute your ideas and skills to our mission to rethink health. Whether you are a pharmacist, IT expert or entrepreneur, creative idea generator or structured, logical thinker, manager or trainee - at DocMorris, every individual can make the difference.

Show more

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Bestandskunden
Description:
Gestalte die digitale Zukunft von CallOne und die unserer Kund:innen, indem du ein komplexes Datensystem erschließt und visualisierst. Mit deiner Expertise und Freude an Daten, statistischen Methoden und analytischen Tools, sammelst du wichtige Informationen und treibst eine datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung voran.

Deine Aufgaben


Unterstützung bei Entwicklung und Implementierung einer effizienten Power BI Reportingstruktur
Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von relevanten Kennzahlen und Geschäftsentwicklungen
Präsentation der Dashboards in deutscher Sprache für große Bestandskunden
Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architektur und der Automatisierung des Reportings in Zusammenarbeit mit der Fachabteilung


Auf Diese Benefits Darfst Du Dich Freuen


Die "Basics": 30 Tage Urlaub, bis zu 100% remote work möglich, ein fester Feierabend, Mac oder PC- du hast die Wahl, ein Budget für deine Weiterentwicklung, Team-Events, E-Bike, Altersvorsorge und Gutscheine für Amazon & Co. sind einige der Angebote, die unsere CallOne´ler zu schätzen wissen.
We ♥️ AI: Nicht nur bei unseren SaaS-Lösungen, auch im Arbeitsalltag setzen wir auf die unzähligen Möglichkeiten, die KI uns bietet, um Prozesse zu optimieren und uns unsere Arbeit zu erleichtern. Freu dich auf ein tech- und experimentier-freudiges Team, mit dem du tief in die Welt der Künstlichen Intelligenz eintauchen kannst! =)
Arbeit mit Sinn: Mit deiner Arbeit hast du einen positiven Einfluss auf Millionen von Menschen. Unsere Lösungen sind immer einen Herzschlag voraus und setzen neue Standards im Kundenservice. So leistest du mit deiner Arbeit einen echten Mehrwert und trägst dazu bei, dass Service Hotlines ihrem Namen endlich wieder alle Ehre machen.
Teamwork: Was wir an CallOne besonders lieben? Unsere Kollegen (w/m/d)! Wir halten einander den Rücken frei, nehmen uns selbst nicht zu ernst und können uns immer aufeinander verlassen. Egal ob remote oder an einem unserer drei Standorte, bei uns ist Team Work keine hohle Phrase!
Job Crafting 4.0: Du gestaltest deinen Job, mit deiner Erfahrung, deinen Stärken, Ideen und Vorlieben. Wir fördern dich mit allem, was du dafür brauchst, und entwerfen gemeinsamen den Job, der zu dir und deinem Leben passt.
Gemeinsam wachsen: Dein Wissen ist unser aller Gewinn. Deshalb spielen wir dir regelmäßig Updates auf, in Form von Konferenzen, Workshops, Kursen, Trainings, neuster Technik – was immer du brauchst, um dich beruflich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln.
Kein Lari-Fari: Was du tust, vergammelt nicht in einer Schublade, sondern kommt zum Einsatz. Auf unnötige Bürokratie und stundenlange Meetings haben wir keine Lust. Wir arbeiten fokussiert, hands-on und mit einem Blick fürs Wesentliche.


Das wünschen wir uns von dir


mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Vertrieb oder einer anderen beratenden Tätigkeit
sehr gute Vorkenntnisse mit Programmen zur Datenauswertung (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Schrift und Sprache
Sicherer Umgang mit Excel und SQL
sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten für Kunden in deutscher Sprache
Kenntnisse im Auf-/Ausbau von BI-Systemen
Strukturierte, sowie analytische Arbeitsweise
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement im SaaS-Umfeld


Über CallOne

CallOne steht für moderne, cloud-basierte Kommunikations- und IT-Lösungen, die dank unseres engagierten Teams bereits in mehr als 4.000 Unternehmen zum Einsatz kommen. Als SaaS-Anbieter versorgen wir Kunden wie Check24, SodaStream und die Helios-Kliniken-Gruppe mit Telefonie, E-Mail, Chat und sprachbasierten Technologielösungen, die in der Service Branche ihresgleichen suchen. So sind wir beispielsweise das erste Unternehmen, das “über Nacht” eine funktionierende, ChatGPT-basierte Voice Lösung gelauncht hat.

Über 10 Jahre erfolgreiches, profitables Unternehmertum hat nicht nur unsere Kunden, sondern jüngst auch unsere Investoren überzeugt. So sind wir seit Mitte 2022 glücklicher Teil der Comdesk Gruppe, die unter ihrem Dach die Marken CallOne, Inopla und Comdesk vereint, um unser Unternehmenswachstum weiter voranzutreiben.

Du willst wissen, wie wir CallOne´ler ticken?

Exklusive Einblicke hinter die Kulissen erhältst du HIER: https://bit.ly/Comdesk_team 🙂

Noch mehr Infos über CallOne als Arbeitgeber gefällig?

Dann schau doch mal auf unserer Karriereseite vorbei: https://www.callone.de/karriere-bei-callone
Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM
Description:
Um unseren Kunden passgenaue Produkte und einen bestmöglichen Service anbieten zu können, ist die Analyse und Interpretation von Daten essentiell. Als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Clients bei Verti liegt Dein Fokus auf der Datenaufbereitung und -analyse unserer Bestandskundendaten. Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden noch zielgruppengerechter anzusprechen und dadurch stärker an uns zu binden. Die Interaktion und der lösungsorientierte Austausch im eigenen Team aber vor allem auch mit anderen datengetriebenen Unternehmensbereichen ist uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nutze die Möglichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage für richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein können. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verstärkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Standort: Teltow

Startdatum: nach Vereinbarung

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM

Das erwartet Dich:


Extrahierung von Bestandskunden-Daten, Durchführung von komplexen Datenanalysen und Erarbeitung von Prognosemodellen zur Lösung datengetriebener Fragestellungen und zur Generierung von Customer Insights entlang der gesamten Customer Journey
Definition von Zielstellungen für die bestandserhalt- oder kundenwertfördernden Aktionen gemeinsam mit dem CRM-Team
Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekräftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und Überwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen zur Förderung des Bestandserhalts oder der Kundenwerterhöhung und Kommunikation dieser im eigenen Team sowie an das Management
Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Das bringst Du mit:


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit relevantem Schwerpunkt (Betriebswirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik etc.) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den gängigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkvermögen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstständige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verständlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europäischen Union
Deutschkenntnisse Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


Das bieten wir Dir:

Ein verlässlicher Partner in besonderen Zeiten: Wir bieten unseren Bewerberinnen und Bewerbern Verlässlichkeit und Perspektiven in der aktuellen Situation und stellen weiterhin ein. Dabei haben die Gesundheit und Sicherheit unserer Bewerberinnen und Bewerber sowie unserer Mitarbeitenden oberste Priorität. Wir nutzen im Bewerbungsprozess virtuelle Medien (bspw. Video-Interviews) und halten uns bei persönlichen Gesprächen an definierte Hygiene- und Abstandsregeln.

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir für Diversität und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution - we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.

But there’s more work to be done - that’s why we need you to join us.

Job Description

If you’re a skilled Data Engineer with experience inC#, Python,Azure, Synapse or Databricks,you can start a career that helps to solve the climate crisis, with Statkraft. You will be a key resource in the development of our cloud data platform, realizing business value with data.

Working in Integration and RPA

We are a specialist team responsible for delivering integration, data solutions and RPA to all business areas in Statkraft across the globe. Some examples are:

Delivering customized integration solutions that connects the different business areas, business processes and systems that supports the whole value chain in Statkraft
Processes, structures, stores, and quality assure a huge amount of data every day
Automating business process and data harvesting with RPA

On a technical level, we deliver on a wide technology stack ranging from e.g. C#, Python, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure API Management, Azure Data Factory, and more.

Integration, data, and RPA are essential for Statkraft to remain a market leader in renewable energy production, and we are now looking for great people to join our team. If you enjoy challenging yourself and working in a competitive industry where technology is evolving the business we operate in, then we would love to talk to you. If you are motivated by working for a company that is a key part of the solution for creating an environmentally sustainable society then Statkraft is the company for you.

As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with business users in many parts of the company across the globe. As Data Engineer in the Integration and RPA team, you’ll:

Develop core functionality for our cloud data platform with a solid focus on business insight, innovation, performance, data quality and self-service
Explore new and challenging data use cases by collaborating with various business and IT teams
Help Statkraft shape our digital foundation for the future

Qualifications

We look for experienced Data Engineers with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes knowledge in:

Relevant Data Engineer experience
Relevant Azure experience
Good C# or Python development skills
Eager to learn more about new trends and technologies
Fluent in English and preferably Norwegian

Experiences in these areas are also useful in your role:

Understanding of time series
Understanding of the energy management, trading, or finance domains
Defining and scoping data quality measures
Experience with Azure DevOps

At Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to explore, learn, lead, teach and help others learn.

Additional Information

What we offer

Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation
The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgrounds
A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principles
Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance
Relocation support if needed.

Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.

Statkraft's vision is to renew the way the world is powered. To navigate the complex journey ahead, we need every voice at the table.

We therefore work actively to be a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome all applicants regardless of background, gender, age, sexual orientation, religious belief, ethnicity, nationality or disability.

We evaluate applications for this role on a rolling basis, so please apply with your CV through our career pages as soon as possible.

Location: Oslo, Berlin or Düsseldorf.

We evaluate applications for this role on a rolling basis, so please apply with your CV through our career pages as soon as possible.

Location: Oslo, Berlin or Düsseldorf.

Title: Data Engineer (w/d/m)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE TÄTIGKEITSSCHWERPUNKTE

Konzeption, Entwicklung und Wartung von Datenpipelines zur Erfassung, Verarbeitung und Speicherung umfangreicher Datenströme
Implementierung von skalierbaren Datenbanken, Data Warehouses und anderen Speicherlösungen
Optimierung der Dateninfrastruktur hinsichtlich Skalierbarkeit, Leistung und Zuverlässigkeit
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Datenanalysten, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern, um Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen zu entwickeln
Gewährleistung der Einhaltung von Datenschutz- und Sicherheitsstandards in allen Phasen der Datenverarbeitung







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem ähnlichen Fachbereich
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Datenpipelines und -infrastrukturen
Kenntnisse in Datenbanktechnologien wie SQL, NoSQL sowie in Big-Data-Frameworks wie z.B. Hadoop, Spark o.ä. sind ein Plus
Programmierkenntnisse in Python, Java oder Scala
Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem agilen Umfeld zu arbeiten
Analytische Denkweise und ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

*Mut zur Lücke! Auch wenn Sie nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen: Trauen Sie sich und bewerben Sie sich bei uns!







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil im Homeoffice zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).
