Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Summary

Location

United Kingdom

Job Family

Digital & Technology

Job Type

Full Time

Posted Date

01-Jul-2024

Ref #

59805

We're hiring for a seasoned Data Analyst on a 10 month fixed term contract.

Working closely with stakeholders, you'll need to be confident handling multiple simultaneous tasks, prioritize work, and remain functional in a fast paced environment. As a Data Analyst you'll also be involved in identifying, evaluating, and documenting potential data sources in support of a wide range of projects, ensuring timely data-loading while maintaining accuracy and relevance of data.

Who we are

The UK’s fastest broadband network. The nation’s best-loved mobile brand. And, one of the UK's biggest companies too.

Diverse, high performing teams - jam packed with serious talent. Together, we offer the UK more choice and better value, through our boundary-pushing, customer-championing values and ambitions.

Together, we are Virgin Media O2, and we can't wait to see what you can do.

Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all

Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and we're working hard to remove bias and barriers for our people and candidates. So, we build equity and inclusion into everything we do, from the policies we craft to the relationships we shape. We support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;


Strong SQL skills
Experience with designing and implementing ETL processes for data integration.
Proficient in acquiring and documenting data from various sources.
Demonstrable experience with data visualisation tools, ideally Tableau.



The other stuff we are looking for

We'd also love you to bring;


Commercial experience with dbt.
Hands on experience using BigQuery.



What's in it for you

Our goal is to celebrate our people, their lives and everything in-between. We aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world.

Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you’d like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you’re covered no matter what life throws your way.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore we may bring the closing date forward. We encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: £30k-£60k – London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities

Competitive bonus scheme

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Manager

D2C | Entertainment | App

£45,000 - £60,000

London | Hybrid







The Company:

This company has created a culinary community that transforms the everyday cooking experience into a vibrant and accessible adventure. With a focus on bringing people together through food, it offers a unique blend of creative recipes, budget-friendly meal ideas, and engaging content that inspires both novice and experienced cooks. The approach goes beyond traditional cooking shows, infusing each dish with a sense of fun, inclusivity, and practicality. This group turns the kitchen into a social hub where delicious meals are created and shared, making cooking a delightful part of everyday life.







As Data Analytics Manager you will:

Develop and optimize our data infrastructure to ensure scalable tools, architecture, and technical projects for analytics.
Analyse customer data to deeply understand our audience and transform these insights into actionable outcomes that align with business objectives.
Identify which content and product features drive user acquisition, monetization, and retention.
Provide data to the Marketing team to clarify which marketing channels are most effective for acquiring, monetizing, and retaining users.
Translate complex analyses into understandable insights and conclusions.
Manage and enhance existing dashboards and reporting systems, promoting data accessibility for stakeholders to improve data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to guide and shape product personalization.
Recommend updates to product and engineering roadmaps to enhance data quality in source systems and strengthen analytical workflows.
Ensure data solutions are well-documented for consistent organizational use.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders and become a trusted partner to promote a data-driven culture.
Identify and validate opportunities to inform growth and product strategy, including new areas like B2B consumer insights.







Experience:

You have over 3 years of experience using analytics to address business questions and drive value toward business goals.
Experience as a Data Analyst in a D2C business is preferred but not required. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of effectively solving business challenges and acting on dynamic insights promptly, with a curiosity for understanding and influencing consumer behavior on digital platforms.
A creative thinker who excels at developing, presenting, and utilizing data, with strong communication skills and the ability to present data in an effective, compelling, and concise manner that influences everyday business operations.
Comfortable working cross-functionally, with an understanding of various functions and how they contribute to the business (e.g., understanding the nuances of marketing and its interplay with product analytics).
We are a fast-growing start-up, so you must be comfortable working in small, agile teams where everyone gets involved.







If you're interested in the Data Analytics Manager role please apply below...

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity Hub UK is seeking a bright and motivated Data Analyst to join a growing team within a leading company. This exciting role offers the chance to leverage your data skills and contribute to meaningful projects across various departments.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role in supporting data-driven decision-making across the organization. You'll collaborate with teams, analyse datasets, and translate insights into actionable recommendations, contributing to the company's success.

Here's What You'll Be Doing


Collaborate with external data providers to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Partner with various departments to understand their data needs and develop effective solutions.
Monitor and respond to internal data requests, providing timely and accurate information.
Maintain data quality and consistency within internal systems.
Support product teams with data analysis, informing project development and implementation.


Here are the skills you'll need:


Strong foundation in SQL, Excel, and Google Sheets.
Minimum two years of commercial experience in an analyst role.
Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Eagerness to learn and demonstrate initiative.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


Benefits of this Job:


Develop your skills: We invest in your learning through training, conferences, and online courses.
Collaborative environment: Be part of a passionate and supportive team.
Competitive compensation: Salary range of £25 - £30K per annum, dependent on experience.
Employee share option plan: Participate in the company's growth.
Generous benefits package: 25 days holiday, pension scheme, private medical insurance, and more.
Engaging work culture: Weekly demos, team meetings, company outings, and perks like fitness classes and office social events.


Work Permissions: You must have the right to work in the United Kingdom. Visa sponsorship is not available at this time.

The data analyst field offers a rewarding and dynamic career path with diverse opportunities. As a Data Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making, using your skills to solve complex problems and impact the organization's success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are delighted to be working with a global specialist Insurance firm that are looking to expand there analytics team with an experienced Data analyst.




This company are experts across various areas within insurance and reinsurance and are becoming a go to household name within the sector, they have rapidly expanded and brought in 10,000+ new employees globally in the last 4 years.




Responsibilities:




Use data to solve problems and identify new opportunities.
Develop insights and create case studies for clients.
Oversee data needs for new business proposals.
Quickly transform data into actionable insights using specialized tools.
Address and monitor data-related queries.
Analyze data to detect trends.
Implement processes and systems for better data management.
Explore innovative methods for data utilization.
Work with data teams across the organization, including IT.




Requirements:




4+ years experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience in the Insurance industry
Strong attention to detail and quick understanding of insurance financials.
Proficiency in MS Excel, Python, SQL and/or R, Databricks.
Expertise in PowerBI or other visualization tools.
Engaging and inquisitive personality with problem-solving skills.
Strong business acumen, arithmetic skills, and intellectual curiosity.
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Experience in good practice UX/UI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to £70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that’s fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: £30,000 - £35,000




Join a pioneering London-based Financial Services company that is transforming the insurance landscape with innovative solutions. With a remarkable access to funding secured in the last 6 months, this Series-A funded company is poised for exponential growth and is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team.




Role Overview:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting complex data to help shape the future of financial technology. Your insights will drive key business decisions and contribute to the development of cutting-edge investment products. This position offers the flexibility of working fully remotely while being part of an exciting and fast-paced environment.

- Bachelor's or Master's from a russell group university, and a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

- Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL




Benefits:

- Performance-based bonus

- Private health and dental insurance

- Stock options

- Opportunity to work in a fully-remote position

- Be part of a fast-growing company with significant funding and growth potential




How to Apply:

If you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst looking to make a significant impact in the Financial Services industry, we would love to hear from you. Please click apply for immediate consideration

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NBFI (Non-Banking Financial Institution) Data Analyst

Fitch Group is currently seeking an NBFI Data Analyst based out of our London office.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

The Data Analyst will be part of our Data Operations team responsible for collection and extraction of all fundamental data needed across Fitch Group.

Candidates will be required to analyse and maintain data for NBFI entities within Fitch systems. More specifically they will be required to interpret financial data from annual and other periodic reports, to ensure data is extracted from the balance sheet, income statement and associated notes in line with Fitch methodology. Candidates will also be required to support client queries on this data as they arise.

What We Offer


This is a great chance to join a growing team responsible for Fitch’s fundamental data collection, supporting Ratings and Solutions.
Exposure to the latest technology, as processes are transformed to leverage AI/ML.


We’ll Count On You To


Analyse financial data to ensure information from annual or periodical reports has been collected in line with Fitch methodology
Communicate effectively with Internal and external stakeholders on financial data decisions and queries via email, on the phone or face to face
Proactively make recommendations on process improvements to the data capture/ quality assurance process, and assist with the implementation of new processes, through training and documentation updates.


What You Need To Have


A sound knowledge of accounting practices to interpret all aspects of a financial report, ideally qualified to a degree standard in accountancy or business studies.
Prior experience working with financial statement fundamental data preferred.
A second language would be advantageous.


What Would Make You Stand Out


Excellent administration and communication skills.
Must have a highly organised and methodical approach to work.
To be a self-starter who can pick up new processes quickly and accurately.
Can work effectively within a team environment.
Have a can-do attitude to problems.


Why Fitch?

At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority. We are building incredible things at Fitch, and we invite you to join us on our journey.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

For More Information, Please Visit Our Websites

www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interest or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.

Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst - Paid Display
Description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money. For everyone, everywhere. More about our mission.

Job Description

We are looking for a Performance Marketing Analyst to support the Paid Display marketing team! As part of our Marketing Analytics team, you will be embedded within the Paid Display team.

Your mission will be to proactively contribute with the channel optimisation and growth through data driven insights and to be responsible for the analytical requirements of the team.

Here’s How You’ll Be Contributing


You will own the paid display data pipelines and analytical domains, improving them as needed.
You will provide actionable insights to inform paid display decisions, from identifying strengths and areas for improvement.
You will provide analytical insights and findings that help the team to optimise their campaigns.
You will propose and execute incrementality tests to measure the real value of paid display campaigns. Additionally, you will collaborate with Paid Display managers to support and validate their testing ideas.
You will help the team improve the marketing message segmentation strategy.
You will maintain and create reports and dashboards to equip the team with the data they need for decision making.
You will contribute defining impactful OKRs to work throughout the quarter.


This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To


Be part of our mission to make money without borders!
Contribute to the growth of the company by enhancing the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
Collaborate with diverse teams such as marketing, analytics, data science and engineering.
Continue learning and developing in areas such as data analysis, performance tracking and marketing measurement.


Qualifications


You have experience with value based bidding, lookalike optimisation, targeting and creative optimisation.
You have advanced SQL skills
Python/R skills are advantageous.
You are able to demonstrate that you can tell a story with data and proactively give guidance on strategy based on insights.
You are familiar with tracking, attribution and MMP data.
You have experience with marketing measurement tools and are familiar with common methodologies.
You are familiar with in-platform tests.
You have experience with data visualisation tools (Looker, Superset, etc.).
You have worked with marketing teams and/or external marketing partners and can manage senior stakeholders.


Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

  • You will propose and execute incrementality tests to measure the real value of paid display campaigns. Additionally, you will collaborate with Paid Display managers to support and validate their testing ideas.
  • You will help the team improve the marketing message segmentation strategy.
  • You will maintain and create reports and dashboards to equip the team with the data they need for decision making.
  • You will contribute defining impactful OKRs to work throughout the quarter.

This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To

  • Be part of our mission to make money without borders!
  • Contribute to the growth of the company by enhancing the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
  • Collaborate with diverse teams such as marketing, analytics, data science and engineering.
  • Continue learning and developing in areas such as data analysis, performance tracking and marketing measurement.

Qualifications

  • You have experience with value based bidding, lookalike optimisation, targeting and creative optimisation.
  • You have advanced SQL skills
  • Python/R skills are advantageous.
  • You are able to demonstrate that you can tell a story with data and proactively give guidance on strategy based on insights.
  • You are familiar with tracking, attribution and MMP data.
  • You have experience with marketing measurement tools and are familiar with common methodologies.
  • You are familiar with in-platform tests.
  • You have experience with data visualisation tools (Looker, Superset, etc.).
  • You have worked with marketing teams and/or external marketing partners and can manage senior stakeholders.

Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

LONDON

HYBRID - 4 DAYS IN THE OFFICE A WEEK

UP TO £50K




This role cannot sponsor




THE COMPANY

A real estate company focused utilises data for investment in property, and development of the market managing purpose-built assets focused in the Pan Europe market




THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role you will be responsible for gathering data from the investment and real estate teams, analysing it, and providing advice on areas of growth in investment real estate




In this role you will be:

Collecting, cleaning, and analysing data to help develop visually appealing dashboards in Power BI and Tableau
Collaborating with the real estate and investment team to help identify areas of growth for the company to help optimise their performance
Utilising statistical methods to help solve business problems
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity by implementing best practices




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

They are looking for someone who comes from a statistical background in either the real estate or investment analytics industry




Please apply if:

Proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau
Proven experience in either investment analytics or real estate data
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with non-technical and technical people
Proven ability to work autonomously and manage your own projects end-to-end
Full right to work in the UK




HOW TO APPLY

Please do so via the website

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A prominent law firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst and can produce key analysis on various topics in particular regulatory reporting.

Responsibilities

Understand the New Business function, identifying risks involved with new clients and matters, and produce analysis and key insights to manage these risks globally.
Produce and maintain compliance and regulatory reports for internal and external clients, and regulatory bodies, while creating and updating dashboards to track metrics and visualize insights.
Build and maintain a suite of reports using Excel, SQL, and PowerBI for regular weekly and monthly reporting, working closely with the Financial Crime Team to manage new client workflow and compliance.
Enhance data integrity through ongoing manual data cleansing and collaborate with relevant teams to ensure proper data maintenance and establish Data Entry Standards.
Provide analytical support for new business initiatives, identify process efficiencies, support annual reviews of third-party software, and review new technologies, including Generative AI, to improve NB&ER processes.




Requirements

At least 1-2 years previous data analysis experience ideally within a law firm.
Expert user of Excel with experience of building and using own sophisticated spreadsheets with pivot tables and macros.
A good working knowledge of all other Microsoft packages (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) is essential for the role.
Ideally knowledge of SQL and Power BI.

  • Ideally knowledge of SQL and Power BI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you seeking a new challenge in a dynamic and impactful organization? The Behavioural Insights Team (BIT) is looking for a passionate individual to support data-driven business decisions and operational excellence. This role involves explaining the story behind the numbers and working with various stakeholders to drive commercial performance, aligning with BIT’s social impact aims and continuous improvement.




About BIT:

The Behavioural Insights Team is a social purpose company that collaborates with governments, businesses, and charities to address major policy issues through simple yet powerful changes. With 250 staff across 8 countries, BIT has completed over 1000 projects, including 700 randomized controlled trials, to improve lives and communities. Acquired by Nesta in 2021, BIT continues to share expertise and build capacity in applying behavioural science for social good




Role and Responsibilities:

This newly created role is in BIT’s Data team, reporting to the Head of Data Visualisation to support the day-to-day business running of Power BI and the improvement of efficiencies in the business. You will play a crucial role in monitoring data quality, correcting data issues, and supporting the finance team with month-end reporting.




Key responsibilities include:

Data Quality and Maintenance: Monitor reports for data quality, correct data issues, and ensure the main data system is current. Become an expert in using the system and advise users across the business.
Data Integration and Visualization: Use Power BI to connect to various data sources, manipulate data, and display it in an easily digestible format. Perform statistical analysis of data and create understandable reports and visualizations.
Ad-Hoc Data Requests: Handle ad-hoc data requests from around the business, providing support with exports from Power BI or other data systems.
Support Finance Team: Assist with the budgeting process for the finance team using G-Sheets and Power BI, and support month-end reporting by reconciling data between sources.
Stakeholder Engagement: Liaise with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements for reporting, and work to deliver these reports.




Skills and Experience:

Data Analysis: Strong interest in and passion for data analysis. Proficiency in using tools such as Excel/Google Sheets for data extraction and analysis. Extensive experience with Power BI, including connecting to data sources, manipulating data, and creating visualizations.
Process Improvement: Ability to analyze, prioritize, and redesign business processes to simplify, automate, and reduce workload—experience in planning, implementing, and communicating changes effectively.
Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
Time Management: Proven ability to manage deadlines and priorities to produce high-quality work within reasonable timeframes.
Teamwork: Although this role will be mainly independent, experience in collaborating with team members and providing support to ensure successful project outcomes. Ability to manage workload effectively and care about the success and well-being of others.
Ability to work independently: Ability to carry out all the above skills independently as this will be a self-sufficient role.




Qualifications:

A bachelor's degree (or equivalent qualification) in a relevant field, such as Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or a related discipline.
1-3 years of experience in a data analyst role, focusing on using Power BI (with both M-Query and DAX) for data visualization and analysis.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Have:

Experience working with overseas subsidiaries.
Experience in professional services or consultancy businesses.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Benefits - London
HTML:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
Performance & Incentives (P&I) are powerful tools for furthering the company's strategic goals. A robust P&I strategy influences the organization's ability to attract and retain the best talent, while creating a strong alignment of individuals' interests with the organization's strategic goals. The P&I Team at ByteDance, therefore, are constantly benchmarking and striving for the best practice & return on investment in developing competitive C&B policies. The P&I Team works on a lot of interesting problems. Whether it is developing new world-class compensation policies, diving deep into market research, analyzing big data and benchmarking. The P&I Team work on a lot of cool and exciting projects to come up with the best ways to serve our organization. Given the nature of our work, it also creates huge opportunities for collaboration with departments in and outside of the HR organization.

Parts of this role will require providing support across ByteDance, as well as TikTok. ByteDance is TikTok's parent company, whose mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life.

What You Will Do:
- Contribute towards the ongoing rollout of ByteDance's global benefits strategy, and improve outcomes for 27 countries in EMEA through building and optimising the team's decision-making processes;
- Leading and executing local and regional benefits projects end-to-end using analytical methods including, but not limited to, data mining, industry research, user research, etc;
- Identify, define and help to prioritise benefits projects to empower the team to reach goals effectively;
- Manage critical benefits vendor relationships and building performance tracking systems;
- Developing strategic partnerships and negotiate commercial terms.

Qualifications

 Minimium Qualifications
- Experienced in people/human resource analysis, or business/data analysis;
- Fluency in English;
- Proven in report writing skills, be able to do proposals based on research and analysis, which are presentable to stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications
- Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a human resource, business or data analytics capacity;
- Knowledge and experience in SQL, Python or SPSS is an advantage;
- Self-motivation and curiosity, fast-learning to discover the relationship between data and human resources policies;
- Strong communication skills in English;
- Experienced working in fast-paced environment, preferably in a tech firm.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About the job



My client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their data team. This role will be pivotal in modeling data and constructing their internal data platform for the first time. Key responsibilities include using dbt to transform data into accurate and dynamic models for business insights and reporting. Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist in the entire data process, from digestion to visualization.



Role Requirements


Collaborate with data scientists to design, evaluate, and monitor the performance of models and algorithms.
Work with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to address client and user challenges.
Ensure accurate data collection in partnership with data engineers.
Enhance customer understanding to provide tailored solutions.
Conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data cleaning to insight extraction.
Demonstrate value to prospective clients by expanding on existing tools and techniques.
Develop innovative methods to showcase key analysis from complex data sets.
Drive product and business strategy through analytical findings.


Required Skills


2/3+ years of experience as a data analyst.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python (especially Pandas) and SQL.
Solid understanding of statistical methods.
Experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Superset, etc.
Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Knowledge of data ethics.
Ability to present analysis and insights to diverse audiences.
Strong work ethic and a thirst for knowledge.


Desired Skills


Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Fluency in statistics.
Good understanding of computer science concepts.
Domain knowledge or experience in the Financial Services industry or Fintech companies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about the world of finance and trading? Do you have a knack for numbers and a love for problem-solving? If so, MillerMaxwell have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are assisting a globally recognised firm, known for their innovative approach to electronic trading. A wide variety of their advanced tools and strategies have been helping institutions around the world to reduce transaction costs and improve investment performance for over 50 years.




What’s in it for you?

Be part of a team of experienced quants and algorithmic developers.
Get involved in a variety of tasks, from analysing market microstructure to overseeing key performance metrics for algo performance.
Opportunity to work on the conceptual and programmatic development of cutting-edge algorithms and analytics applications.
Front office role with interaction with traders and external clients.




Key Responsibilities:

Detailed analysis of market parameters and trading components.
Research into the prediction of market liquidity.
Analysis and implementation of potential new trading strategies.
Programming and delivering bespoke solutions for internal and external clients.




What we’re looking for:

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Good organizational skills and ability to oversee meetings with senior managers and other teams.
Some prior experience with programming languages (Python preferred).
Familiarity with database structures and large query optimization.
Understand and reasonable usage of data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Qlik or similar.
Experience with the analysis of large financial data sets.
Understanding and reasonable usage of data visualization tools.
Great team player with excellent command of the English language.
Able to work independently and solve and prioritize problems under time pressure.




If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and make a real impact in the world of finance, apply today! This is more than just a job - it’s a chance to shape the future of trading. Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




We’re an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we’ve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world’s leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.




In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.




Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.




We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!




About the Role




In the Data capability at BJSS you'll join multi-disciplinary teams with some of the brightest and best in the industry. You’ll create powerful dashboards to bring data insights to life, helping businesses make better decisions with their data.




You'll help us deliver some of the most exciting digital programmes around, for clients in a range of industries by:

Applying cross-disciplinary thinking and working collaboratively with other members of your team
Building a deep understanding of business domain and user needs and ensuring business value is unlocked as early as possible
Thinking holistically and treating data as a business service
Designing BI as centre of excellence for business data




About You




We're looking for people who will go an extra mile to understand our clients' strategic and operational challenges and help us to design and deliver innovative solutions.




You should have experience with:

Exploratory data analysis or have experience profiling and cleaning the data, using common tools in Python or SQL
Data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau or Qlik)




You should also have experience with some of the following:

Data modelling, building data dictionaries and data governance experience
Experience with cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Azure or GCP)
Experience working with Agile methodologies




You will have:

Strong communication skills to be involved in sprint planning, backlog refinement and presenting BI back to the stakeholders.
Experience in designing visual dashboards which tell a story about the data to the business users in a well-designed and easy to follow format.




Above all you'll be passionate about unlocking the power of data to deliver business value.




Some of the Perks

Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
Flexible holiday buy/sell option
Electric vehicle scheme
Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O’Reilly
Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
We have a busy social calendar that you can choose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
GymFlex gym membership programme




Please note: any applicants must be able to gain valid SC clearance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years’ worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.


What We're Looking For In Our Applicants


Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits


Competitive holiday allowance
Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
Flexible working patterns
Workplace Pension Scheme
Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Referral Bonus Scheme
Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)
Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years’ worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities

  • Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
  • Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
  • Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
  • Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
  • Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.

What We're Looking For In Our Applicants

  • Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.

Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits

  • Competitive holiday allowance
  • Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
  • Flexible working patterns
  • Workplace Pension Scheme
  • Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
  • Discretionary Bonus Scheme
  • Referral Bonus Scheme
  • Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency’s vision. And most importantly we value every individual’s wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one – but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. That’s why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

You’re better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a “Me” day and an “Us” day, every year. Your “Me” day is for you to invest in yourself – go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your “Us” day is all about giving back and helping others – volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

We’re progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example we’ve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isn’t always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you’ll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won’t be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clients’ objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master’s degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 – 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.


Recruitment process

We’re not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

We are RAPP. And we can’t wait to meet you
Show more

Title: Junior BI Analyst – London/Manchester
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Junior BI Analyst – London/Manchester







Junior BI Analyst required for a leading client based in Oxford. My client is currently seeking a Junior BI Analyst to come on board and support the development of the data warehouse to expand the reporting capabilities and integrate new data sources. You will be responsible for delivering end-to-end reporting solutions to stakeholders and will receive guidance and support from the team.




Hybrid working available at either London, Leeds, Oxford or Manchester Office




The salary for this role is £30,000 - £35,000 per annum




Key responsibilities:

Staging & shaping data from multiple data sources into reporting and analytical solutions and integrations
Developing and maintaining analytics solutions and perform data analysis
Understand data warehouse modelling and different approaches to take
Expanding our data warehouse, incorporating new data sources, and building in best-practice warehouse design
Creation of technical documentation, capturing development, processes & DW changes
Working closely with the IT department to ensure that the data collection and storage are appropriate and suitable for BI purposes
Troubleshooting and resolving data-related problems
Collaborating with colleagues in the Data and Analytics team to deliver dashboard reports
Engaging with clients (usually but not limited to internal colleagues) to understand their needs, and designing and creating a suitable dashboard report
Identifying and suggesting improvements in delivery of BI to the company
Working with all internal departments to identify suitable metrics specific to their departmental operations and wider BI requests
Identifying new sources of data to be used to grow BI capability
Identifying new uses of existing data to provide insight to the company




Key skills:

Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge and experience in Data Warehouse Schema design, data modelling and data warehouse systems (preferably Snowflake, but not essential)
Practical experience with ETL processes and tools




Interested? Please submit your updated CV to Emma Siwicki at Crimson for immediate consideration.

Not interested? Do you know someone who might be a perfect fit for this role? Refer a friend and earn £250 worth of vouchers! Crimson is acting as an employment agency regarding this vacancy

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on…


Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows


You’ll Love This Role If You Have


SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have


and you...


are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving


Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! 😉)

💰 Competitive base salary and equity, so you own what you build

💳 £100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by £50 for each year of service until you reach £250

🔋 £1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

👩🏽‍💻 £500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

🍔 Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

🏖 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

🌴 ...and an option to buy or sell 5 days per year. Also, your holiday entitlement will increase to 30 days at your 3rd year of service!

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely
Show more

  • have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
  • have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
  • appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
  • are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving

Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! 😉)

💰 Competitive base salary and equity, so you own what you build

💳 £100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by £50 for each year of service until you reach £250

🔋 £1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

👩🏽‍💻 £500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

🍔 Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

🏖 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

🌴 ...and an option to buy or sell 5 days per year. Also, your holiday entitlement will increase to 30 days at your 3rd year of service!

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on…


Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows


You’ll love this role if you have:


SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have


and you...


are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving


Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! 😉)

💰 Competitive base salary and equity, so you own what you build

💳 £100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by £50 for each year of service until you reach £250

🔋 £1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

👩🏽‍💻 £500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

🍔 Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

🏖 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

🌴 ...and an option to buy or sell 5 days per year. Also, your holiday entitlement will increase to 30 days at your 3rd year of service!

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Are you an Insight Analyst with a strong background in quantitative methodologies and passion for technology? Join our growing London-based team and make a significant impact on our data journey!

THE COMPANY

A boutique consultancy who focus on shopper insights within the FMCG and eating/drinking out sectors. They provide a unique combination of expert intelligence in their space, providing essential analysis, market data, insight and trends for their prestigious list of clients, including Nestle, Kraft Heinz, Coca-Cola, Costa, among others. The company have recently undergone a data revolution and have embraced new data visualisation tools and advanced analytics.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyse complex data sets to provide tangible insights for various stakeholders.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

Experience working with questionnaire/survey data.
Working knowledge of Python is essential.
Experience using source code control.

Interested in this Insight Analyst role? Apply now and let's have a chat!


We Are Aspire Ltd are a Disability Confident Commited employer
