Title: Executive, Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading alcohol brand team of a leading global media agency with a large and innovative range of research solutions, to get close to client’s business and communication strategy, to work at a regional and global level with multiple markets, to gain exposure to new data analytics techniques and to build experience across different industries.




Key Responsibilities

Help deliver reporting and Analytics projects and be a point of contact for local teams in this area
Support the team as they pitch for new business, helping them prepare the content for these proposals
Have direct relationships with our clients, for example as you help us to manage the actions from the weekly client status meeting
Work with large datasets to extract meaningful insights
Provide support on answering ad-hoc queries from clients and internal client hub teams - supporting quality and effectiveness across all stages




Skills/Technical Capabilities

Knowledge of Business Intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau or Power BI
Proven knowledge of data quality and reporting solutions
Comfortable working with large datasets to extract insights
You will be a curious learner with great attention to detail and diligence in your work
You need to be creative in the way you solve problems
You should be comfortable discussing your work with clients and colleagues, and be able to present your ideas
Whatever your previous experience, we want you to suggest ideas/approaches and alternatives that may create a better solution or spark a new train of thought.




Our Commitment to You

From our comprehensive development programme to mentoring and on the job experiences, we’ll provide you with lively and stimulating learning to help you develop and progress your career. We marry this with a regular appraisal, that includes 360 feedback and ongoing career catch-ups to discuss how you’re doing.




In addition, your overall wellbeing and happiness is one of our top priorities We have created our own bespoke programme of various activities and workshops to help support good health including mindfulness.




Other great benefits include contributory pension scheme, private medical insurance, and a lot more




At OMD, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.

Central London- 2 X Week

Up to £50,000

To qualify for this role, you will require:

A successful candidate will receive:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: London, UK

Reporting To: Jubin Sadeghi

Compensation: £30,000 - £50,000 / year

Description

White Swan Data is a small but rapidly growing team of mathematicians, data scientists and software engineers who are constantly striving to refine world class betting models while also researching and deploying new ones. Our work bridges three domains, each challenging in its own right - betting and gambling, quantitative research and software development.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst, well-versed in the R programming language, who can pull actionable insights out of large data sets. As a member of the team, you will be working on a variety of different projects and collaborating with the team to ensure we deliver to our clients needs.

We will consider graduate applicants if we feel your degree has equipped you with the necessary skills to further develop in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Dive into diverse datasets to extract meaningful patterns, trends, and insights.
Cleanse and process data to ensure accuracy and reliability in analysis.
Utilise statistical methods to interpret and validate findings, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
Develop comprehensive reports to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay updated on the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics.
Implement and maintain data quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability of analytical outputs.


Requirements

Must Have -


Proficiency in the R programming language, ideally ggplot2, tidyverse and data.table.
Advanced spreadsheeting skills, ideally google-sheets and Excel.
A passion for data analytics and a desire to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A Bachelor's degree in a data-oriented subject (statistics, econometrics, economics etc) and/or several years of highly relevant experience in data analysis using the above software.


Desirable -


Previous experience using the SQL/Sequel programming language.
Experience in creating compelling visualisations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Grafana software.
Experience of data manipulation, management and reporting.
Adept at solving analytical problems with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively within a team.
A passion and understanding of sports and sports betting markets/odds.


Benefits


Competitive salary depending on experience.
Annual discretionary performance bonus.
5 days holiday per annum, plus UK bank holidays.
Private health & dental insurance.
Pension plan.
Complimentary gym membership
Regular team events/socials.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital
Description:
Working at the RFU means being part of the ‘bigger picture’ at England Rugby: to be rooted in our purpose, which is to enrich lives, introduce more people to rugby union & develop the sport for future generations. If our purpose resonates with you, and you recognise the value that sport can bring to people’s lives, we’d love to work with you. An opportunity has arisen for a Digital Marketing Analyst (Web) to join the team on a permanent basis.




Job Title : Data Analyst - Digital

Department : Marketing

Reports to : Senior Customer Data Analytics Manager

Job Level : Implement

Location : Twickenham

Employment Type : Permanent




Application Information:

Please submit an anonymised CV and cover letter (i.e. please exclude personal details).
The closing date for applications is Friday 26th July at 5pm.
The RFU reserves the right to close this vacancy early if we receive sufficient applications.
Applications may be considered whilst this vacancy is advertised.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.




Nature and Scope:




The RFU has been undergoing a period of significant change, responding to changes in the external environment whilst adjusting to the demands of a modern governing body. The organisation is currently one year into delivering an exciting strategic plan that hopes to have a transformational impact on Rugby Union.




As part of this strategic plan, the RFU has an ambition to become a data-driven, user-centric organisation with market leading digital capabilities that will not only transform the rugby experience for players, volunteers and fans today, but also future proof the RFU for years to come.




As part of a small Customer Data & Analytics team, you will play a key role in helping the RFU's Marketing & Digital Team transform the experience for our customers through analysis of marketing data and audiences. The role will enable growth for analysts with a digital first mindset and a passion for customer experience whilst contributing to the overall success of the RFU and England Rugby.




The role will analyse web data to identify patterns and trends in order to improve engagement and conversion.
The role will help to augment and improve the quality of data captured.
The role will support marketing campaigns and identify audience preferences.
The role will measure and assess marketing campaigns to provide insight.
This role will measure performance of web advertising.
This role will measure the performance of experiments (e.g. A/B) on the website in collaboration with the Digital Product Team.




What will you be doing?




Some key responsibilities include:

Developing a comprehensive web analytics strategy to deliver the company's digital objectives from platform down to tagging.
Creating and maintaining a roadmap to deliver data quality and enhanced analytics capabilities.
Managing and optimize Google Tooling to ensure accurate data collection and reporting to track benefit realisation and support prioritisation decision-making.
Leading the effort to improve overall analytics effectiveness including segmentation opportunities and personalisation to drive engagement and advocacy.
Supporting the development of new ways to evaluate our digital assets and grow our commercial revenues through key websites.
Analysing web data to identify opportunity areas to optimise performance and improve the overall digital experience.
Creating and delivering regular reports on web performance to the wider business.
Acting as an ambassador for, and promoting the best interests of the RFU, including the promotion of the RFU core values.




Your approach to Life (your behaviours):

You're a strategic thinker who is able to influence and drive change.
You have strong influencing and consensus building skills, and you're able to build sustaining relationships.
You're able to work collaboratively.
You are process driven and able to work well under pressure.
You're able to inspire confidence and create trust.
You possess sound judgement and the ability to think creatively to reach desired goals.




What you Know:




Essential:

Demonstrable experience in a data analysis role or another quantitative field.
Expertise in Google Analytics 4(GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) (GAIQ certified preferred).
Experience in go-to-market, configuring GA4 & GTM to measure success by defining tags, triggers, variables, data streams, events, and enhanced measurement features.
Experience with other web feedback capture tooling e.g. Hotjar, Optimizely.
Proficient with reporting tooling e.g. Looker / Tableau.
Good breadth of knowledge of digital analytics to make recommendations on tooling, best practices, and strategic approach.
Proficiency in debugging and troubleshooting Google analysis-related issues.
Experience with web analytics, A/B & MVT strategy and implementation requirements.
Knowledge of GDPR and other privacy around handling user data.
Effective communication and problem solving ensuring the right people are involved and updated.
Good understanding of software development practices and web/mobile technologies.
Committed to actively contributing to and building an inclusive culture in your role and day to day behaviours.




Desired:

Experience with Salesforce and Marketing Cloud Intelligence (previously Datorama).
Experience with a Customer Data Platform.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Maths, Sciences).




Additional Information:

We want you to have every opportunity to demonstrate your skills, ability and potential. If there is anything we could do to support you through your application or to provide the best environment for your interviews, including assistance or adjustment, please reach out to recruitment@rfu.com.
During your application, we will ask questions about your identity. This information is considered highly confidential and will not be seen by hiring managers. You can find out more about why we ask these questions here.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.

  • Analysing web data to identify opportunity areas to optimise performance and improve the overall digital experience.

  • Acting as an ambassador for, and promoting the best interests of the RFU, including the promotion of the RFU core values.


Your approach to Life (your behaviours):

  • You're a strategic thinker who is able to influence and drive change.
  • You have strong influencing and consensus building skills, and you're able to build sustaining relationships.
  • You're able to work collaboratively.
  • You are process driven and able to work well under pressure.
  • You're able to inspire confidence and create trust.
  • You possess sound judgement and the ability to think creatively to reach desired goals.


What you Know:


Essential:

  • Demonstrable experience in a data analysis role or another quantitative field.
  • Expertise in Google Analytics 4(GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) (GAIQ certified preferred).
  • Experience in go-to-market, configuring GA4 & GTM to measure success by defining tags, triggers, variables, data streams, events, and enhanced measurement features.
  • Experience with other web feedback capture tooling e.g. Hotjar, Optimizely.
  • Proficient with reporting tooling e.g. Looker / Tableau.
  • Good breadth of knowledge of digital analytics to make recommendations on tooling, best practices, and strategic approach.
  • Proficiency in debugging and troubleshooting Google analysis-related issues.
  • Experience with web analytics, A/B & MVT strategy and implementation requirements.
  • Knowledge of GDPR and other privacy around handling user data.
  • Effective communication and problem solving ensuring the right people are involved and updated.
  • Good understanding of software development practices and web/mobile technologies.
  • Committed to actively contributing to and building an inclusive culture in your role and day to day behaviours.


Desired:

  • Experience with Salesforce and Marketing Cloud Intelligence (previously Datorama).
  • Experience with a Customer Data Platform.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Maths, Sciences).


Additional Information:

  • We want you to have every opportunity to demonstrate your skills, ability and potential. If there is anything we could do to support you through your application or to provide the best environment for your interviews, including assistance or adjustment, please reach out to recruitment@rfu.com.
  • During your application, we will ask questions about your identity. This information is considered highly confidential and will not be seen by hiring managers. You can find out more about why we ask these questions here.


To download the full job description for this role, please click here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analysts

Public Sector management consultancy, greenfield team.

Basic salary £30,000 + 20% bonus and comprehensive benefits

Hybrid working – c. 2-3 days per week in the London office




This highly successful management consulting firm specialises in providing value to local government clients through transformational change. Their newly established Analytics team is growing due to increasing demand, and there is great scope to shape the role according to individual’s abilities.




The work involves:

Gathering and cleaning data from multiple sources
Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders
Delivering analytics and insight to identify themes and hypotheses concerning root cause
Creating reports and visualisations which tell a story of the insights generated
Delivering meaningful, long-term and sustainable solutions




Projects include:

Analysing social care data to drive insights and improvements in how the local authority is delivering to its customers
Analysing climate change impacts in the community

Etc




Requirements. You will:

Hold a bachelors’ degree in a STEM subject
Hold a post-graduate degree and/or one year’s relevant work experience in which you have advanced your analysis skills using MS Excel.
Have an interest in developing your Python and Power BI skills
Be able to use data to draw insights and to support idea generation and debate. You will have a natural curiosity that makes you want to explore the data, identify new lines of thought and raise questions to ensure all avenues are explored in support of finding the right solutions for clients
You should be comfortable with ambiguity, incorrect or incomplete data sets and being able to bring that together to produce meaningful information




What’s in it for you?

The chance to join a new team and make the role your own
Working with the leading firm in its sector, and alongside leading players in their field
Meaningful work – climate change, social care etc
A generous benefits package, including 20% bonus, pension and more besides.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading alcohol brand team of a leading global media agency with a large and innovative range of research solutions, to get close to client’s business and communication strategy, to work at a regional and global level with multiple markets, to gain exposure to new data analytics techniques and to build experience across different industries.

As a Data Analyst that owns a market leading portfolio, and you’ll support the team to maintain and build dashboards and various reporting tools. You will support the delivery of reporting solutions and any data analytics project paying particular attention to data governance and to the clients’ requirements.

Our team makes a very significant contribution to our agency’s income through work delivered to our clients, and we support nearly every new business pitch. We also develop simple but original ways to help our account teams interrogate performance and industry data sets to quickly answer key client questions – enabling our mission of Better Decisions, Faster, improving the standard of work on our accounts and giving our agency and clients a competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Balancing all of these competing priorities has become a huge challenge and could hinder our future growth. We need an efficient and pro-active individual to join us. We need help to focus on the right places so that we can deliver our commercial targets and also support the wider agency development roadmap.

Requirements


Experience using Business Intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau or Power BI.
Proven working knowledge of data quality and reporting solutions .
Comfortable working with large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
You will provide support on answering ad-hoc queries from clients and internal client hub teams – supporting quality and effectiveness across all stages.
You will have direct relationships with our clients, for example as you help us to manage the actions from the weekly client status meetings.
Knowledge of coding languages including SQL, Python are preferable.
Knowledge of Datorama and looker studio is desirable.


At OMD EMEA, we strive to deliver on our promise of ‘better decisions, faster‘ for our clients, partners and all 6,000+ OMDers across our region every day. As part of the world’s largest media network, our business is staging experiences for consumers who have more choice and less attention than ever before. The key to the process is empathy. Empathy to see the world through the eyes of the consumer, to recognise the needs of our clients and to identify aspirations of our talent.

Learn Fast, Act Fast. To help navigate the road to a ‘new normal’, learning from, and acting upon data signals at scale and speed is crucial. Visit Why OMD? to learn more about our unique Act Fast Framework.

Be Your Best

We want everyone to make the most of the opportunity to shine and showcase your talents and we are happy to make adjustments in the recruitment process so you can be your best. Please discuss any specific requirements with your dedicated Talent Team member or if you would feel more comfortable, you can email us confidentially at beyourbest@omnicommediagroup.com to let us know how we can support you.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at OMG

At OMG, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.

We will process your personal data in accordance with our Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on https://omnicommediagroup.com/recruitment-privacy-notices/.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Immediate Start

Central London (4 days a week)

£45,000 - £50,000




The Company

A leading property investment and development firm specialising in the Student Accommodation and Build to Rent sectors. The focus is on investing, developing, and managing purpose-built assets to create sustainable and high-quality living environments.




The Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst to join immediately. The successful candidate will develop data-driven insights for our investment team, focusing on sustainability, decarbonisation, and end-user behaviour.




Key Responsibilities:

Gather requirements from stakeholders across various teams.
Develop data for the investment team around sustainability, decarbonisation and end-user behaviour.
Design and build metrics, followed by creating data visualizations in Power BI or Tableau to support product launches.
Utilise a tech stack of BigQuery, Tableau, Power BI and SQL.







Your Experience

To qualify for this role, you will require the following:

Strong mathematical or statistical background.
Experience in either Tableau or Power BI.
Industry experience in investment or the real estate sector.
A proactive individual with a keen interest in the property investment and real estate industry, eager to learn and grow within the role.




How to Apply

Please send your CV via the Apply link on this website or send it to carlotashepherd@harnham.com.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
ABOUT ELEVATE SPORTS VENTURES:




Elevate Sports Ventures is a best-in-class sports and entertainment consulting firm, providing proven, innovative solutions to organisations across the international sports and entertainment landscape. Elevate provides thoughtful insights that empower sports teams, leagues, brands, venues, events, and properties with comprehensive, revenue-driving solutions. Elevate’s unparalleled combination of agency and operating experience, along with proprietary products and solutions, maximises efficiencies in Partnership Sales and Consulting; Hospitality Sales and Strategy; Brand Representation; Experiential Design; Feasibility and Revenue Consultation for New and Renovated Venues; Consumer Insights, Research, Strategy and Analytics; and more. Elevate boasts an active client roster of over 175 sports teams, brands, venues, events, and properties from among the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLB, MLS, NWSL, professional US and international football, professional tennis, MMA, motorsports and horse racing, college athletics and more. For more information, follow Elevate on Twitter (@ElevateSV) and LinkedIn.




INSIGHTS ANALYST – OVERVIEW:




Elevate Sports Ventures is looking an individual to join our fast-growing consulting team in the sports and entertainment industry. This individual will focus on supporting projects for Elevate’s clients focused on enhancing the fan experience and operational performance. You will support project objectives and help structure problems, conduct primary and secondary research, conduct business analyses, develop presentations, and support project implementation. This role will cover a range of services across our business, including hospitality design, partnership valuation, and brand representation.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




Project Responsibilities

Support UK, Europe, and Middle East based client projects.
Support projects focused on helping clients improve revenues, business efficiency, and fan experience.
Support project team members in owning project management needs, providing direction and timelines on key activities and deliverables, as well as continual training / coaching.
Lead research efforts, gathering large data sets from disparate sources to pull together insights which support larger recommendations.
Lead survey development and execution, including survey design, content development, and reporting results.
Analyse complex, high-volume data sets to identify narrative trends and actionable insights.
Build financial models to inform pricing strategy and revenue forecasting.
Support partnership valuation and strategy planning, including jewel asset valuation and rate card evaluation.
Facilitate client and stakeholder interviews, including content development, communications, scheduling, and execution.
Develop and present recommendations to internal team members and external client partners.
Build high-quality visualisations that illustrate the stories underlying the data we collect.




Team Management

Develop peer analysts and interns by providing learning opportunities across technical, analytical and “soft skill” competencies.
Collaborate with internal partners to provide all relevant Elevate services and capabilities on each engagement.
Support recruiting, hiring, and onboarding activities with new Insights team members.




QUALIFICATIONS:

The qualifications listed below represent the credentials necessary to perform the essential functions of this position. To be successful in this position, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




A. Education and/or Experience

2+ years of work experience within management consulting, financial services, data analytics, or similar industry/function.
Professional experience in a client service role working with external team members and managing client / external relationships.
Previous sports business industry experience is a plus.

B. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Deep passion for the sports industry, with a genuine interest for solving sports business challenges.
Exceptional organisational skills, ability to lead concurrent projects, and prioritise under the pressure of deadlines.
Ability to develop frameworks and project management tools to guide project approach, timelines, reporting, and decision-making.
Ability to concisely communicate complex statistical insights and findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to conduct rigorous data analysis resulting in high-quality models and presentations.
Intellectual curiosity, creativity, analytical approach, attention to detail, and results-driven.
Strong research skills with the ability to translate data insights into stories.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation and public-speaking experience.
Power user of the MS Office suite, in particular, Excel.
Power user of the Google Drive suite, including Google Slides & Google Sheets.
Experience with Tableau or other data visualisation tools.
Experience with CRM, particularly Salesforce, is a plus.
Experience with SQL, R, or SAS is a plus.




POSITION DETAILS:

Full Time
£40,000 - £45,000
Must be eligible to work in the UK




WORKING CONDITIONS

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required.




Work Environment:

This role will be based in London (Strongly preferred)
Our guideline expectation is for this candidate to work from the London office 3 days a week.
Outside of that guideline, we support flexible working policies.
There is a baseline requirement to work UK hours and regularly attend meetings in and around the UK.
Occasionally, the role will require the ability to work flexible schedules, including weekends and holidays.




This position is open to all qualified candidates. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability in connection with the application process, you may contact us at HR@elevatesv.com.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity/veterans/disabled/ LGBT employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

  • Full Time
  • £40,000 - £45,000
  • Must be eligible to work in the UK

Travel Requirements:

  • Occasional travel may be required.

  • This role will be based in London (Strongly preferred)
  • Our guideline expectation is for this candidate to work from the London office 3 days a week.
  • Outside of that guideline, we support flexible working policies.
  • There is a baseline requirement to work UK hours and regularly attend meetings in and around the UK.
  • Occasionally, the role will require the ability to work flexible schedules, including weekends and holidays.


This position is open to all qualified candidates. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability in connection with the application process, you may contact us at HR@elevatesv.com.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity/veterans/disabled/ LGBT employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Strategy (12 month FTC)
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Strategy Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and the Product Strategy Manager in providing data-driven insights to support strategic decision making. This role will focus on strategic planning and insights, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, executive dashboard reporting as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast paced environment of a growing company, has experience in product analytics and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have a background in data science or advanced product analytics at either a dating, social, gaming or other relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical product and business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of data and use that knowledge to partner with product, strategy and exec level leaders, naturally connecting product, revenue, and broader customer data sources, taking a holistic approach to find answers. You are able to leverage your data modelling and advanced analytics skills to help senior leadership navigate ambiguity and shape analytical roadmaps, projects and insights. You can translate complex analytical findings and business metrics into clear, concise recommendations for product managers, executives, and other stakeholders.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, considers all the potential drivers to a problem, reviewing existing knowledge and bringing in expertise for advice from other teams.

You enjoy efficiently producing insights that inform decision-making and are passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you. You always look for feedback to strive for higher quality of deliverables.

Key Accountabilities


Develop and deliver analytical roadmaps to support long-term product strategy, including executive dashboard reporting, deep-dive analysis, and performance measurement of product changes
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will act as a trusted thought partner as the analytical authority in your domain. You will likely be dedicated to a set of specific initiatives and projects, where you will be expected to act as a representative of the R&A team, demonstrating our values, capabilities, and competencies.
You will develop a deep knowledge on the product domain, becoming the authority on its characteristics, drivers and sub systems. You will proactively educate stakeholder functions to further democratise this understanding.
You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience in data science, statistical analysis, solving complex analytical problems and modelling data that aims to answer a big picture question regarding the business’ long term strategy and direction.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
You have experience in roadmapping and outlining product strategy that influences senior stakeholders.
Preferred experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience with data modelling, advanced analytics and data engineering needed to automate insights, reporting and measurement.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in commercial analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset, machine learning and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.
Show more
HTML:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Strategy Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and the Product Strategy Manager in providing data-driven insights to support strategic decision making. This role will focus on strategic planning and insights, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, executive dashboard reporting as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast paced environment of a growing company, has experience in product analytics and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have a background in data science or advanced product analytics at either a dating, social, gaming or other relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical product and business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of data and use that knowledge to partner with product, strategy and exec level leaders, naturally connecting product, revenue, and broader customer data sources, taking a holistic approach to find answers. You are able to leverage your data modelling and advanced analytics skills to help senior leadership navigate ambiguity and shape analytical roadmaps, projects and insights. You can translate complex analytical findings and business metrics into clear, concise recommendations for product managers, executives, and other stakeholders.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, considers all the potential drivers to a problem, reviewing existing knowledge and bringing in expertise for advice from other teams.

You enjoy efficiently producing insights that inform decision-making and are passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you. You always look for feedback to strive for higher quality of deliverables.

Key Accountabilities

  • Develop and deliver analytical roadmaps to support long-term product strategy, including executive dashboard reporting, deep-dive analysis, and performance measurement of product changes
  • You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
  • You will act as a trusted thought partner as the analytical authority in your domain. You will likely be dedicated to a set of specific initiatives and projects, where you will be expected to act as a representative of the R&A team, demonstrating our values, capabilities, and competencies.
  • You will develop a deep knowledge on the product domain, becoming the authority on its characteristics, drivers and sub systems. You will proactively educate stakeholder functions to further democratise this understanding.
  • You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
  • You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work.
  • You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
  • You will have experience in data science, statistical analysis, solving complex analytical problems and modelling data that aims to answer a big picture question regarding the business’ long term strategy and direction.
  • Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
  • You have experience in roadmapping and outlining product strategy that influences senior stakeholders.
  • Preferred experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
  • Strong experience with data modelling, advanced analytics and data engineering needed to automate insights, reporting and measurement.
  • You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
  • You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
  • 3+ years experience in commercial analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.

About You

  • Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values
  • Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator.
  • A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
  • Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset, machine learning and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
  • Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
  • Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
  • A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
  • Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
  • Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
  • Strong governance and data quality mindset.

About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Title: Data Solutions Analyst
Description:
McDonald’s has run its business in the UK since 1974 and celebrates its 50th anniversary this year. The business currently operates over 1,450 restaurants across the UK and Ireland, serving almost four million customers each day. McDonald’s is one of the UK’s largest private sector employers, employing over 177,000 people.




McDonald’s UK & Ireland has a proven track record of investing in the development of its employees and offering flexibility as part of its dedication to being a modern and progressive company. Every year, it invests over £40 million in developing people, giving every one of its employees the opportunity to take part in structured training.




McDonald’s buys ingredients from over 23,000 British and Irish farmers and spends over £1.1billion annually on its food and packaging requirements. McDonald’s is committed to supporting British and Irish farmers to ensure it can continue to source many of its ingredients from the UK and Ireland.




McDonald’s is a market leader in its field, striving for the highest standard of quality, speed and restaurant experience. Re-generation of our restaurant infrastructure, covering digital ordering, re-imaging and dual-point service make working at McDonald’s more exciting than ever!




We are dedicated to using our scale for good: good for people, our industry and the planet. From bold recycling initiatives and sustainable sourcing efforts to our partnership with Ronald McDonald House Charities, we see every day as a chance to have a genuine impact on our customers, our people and our partners.

We're a people business just as much as we are a restaurant business. We strive to be the most inclusive brand in the world by building diverse teams who create delicious, feel-good moments that are easy for everyone to enjoy. Joining McDonald's means thinking big every day and preparing for a career that can have impact around the world.




Company Vision and Culture…




Our Global vision is to build a better McDonald’s and, in the UK, and Ireland we are working hard to be the UK & Irelands best-loved restaurant company.

McDonald’s is defined by its culture. Our culture shapes and informs everything we think and everything we do. Our culture influences the way we interact with each other, and how we interact with customers, franchisees and suppliers. Our culture motivates and inspires us to attract and retain great talent, creating positive, energising, exceptional working environment for us all.




Our values drive our culture and shape our beliefs, our priorities and our actions. They influence the decisions we make, how we treat one another and how we show up as a brand to the world.




Serve: We put our customers and our people first

Inclusion: We open our doors to everyone

Integrity: We do the right thing

Community: We are good neighbours

Family: We get better together




Job Description




The Opportunity

The Data Solutions Analyst role is an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact within a growing team, with potential for future growth and development.

The role of Data Solutions Analyst is about much more than analysing. You'll be engaged at every step of the data value-chain, facilitating the transformation of raw data into valuable data solutions. Think of yourself as the 'Data Shepherd', guiding and channelling data safely along the path to becoming valuable business solutions!

Your overall objective will be to ensure that data solutions fulfil business needs. You'll achieve that by monitoring data quality, supporting data issue resolution, brokering collaboration between business and Technology teams, and facilitating data solution development.

To be successful in this role, you only need to have basic knowledge of data systems, governance, and technologies. But you will absolutely need to balance your ability to apply your own initiative and work autonomously, with a willingness to seek out guidance and accept supervision from your Manager. This role is best suited to someone with an outgoing personality, who enjoys meeting people leading conversations, because as well as collaborating with your peers, you'll also need to proactively and energetically bring Technology and business teams together to streamline work on data projects.

On a day-to-day basis, you'll be accountable for enforcing data governance practices, ensuring data compliance, and collaborating with various business stakeholders to maintain data integrity. This role is instrumental in enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our data operations, and ensuring that our data products are reliable, compliant, and valuable to the business.

If you excel in this role, then over time you'll become someone who is known for helping McDonald’s to 'get data done', and other people will seek you out for help with their data issues and requirements. That reputation combined with the broad experience you'll have acquired, means you'll be ideally placed for further progression in your data career.




What will my accountabilities be?




These will include but are not limited to:

Data Governance & Support
Data Analysis & Insights
Supplier Management




Please click on 'Apply' to find out more !




What Team will I be a part of?




The Data Solutions Analyst will report to the Data Enablement Consultant and operate as part of the wider Cyber Security and Data team within the Running Great Restaurant Technology team.




Who are my customers?




Customers of this role will include:

Data owners and business leads from broader business, technology and data teams such as:
Business stakeholders: Business Strategy & Insights, Restaurant Solutions Group, People, Marketing & Digital, Finance, Supply Chain
Technology: Cyber Security, Service Operations, Asset & Configuration Management, Supplier Management, Deployment & Testing, Innovation & Adoption
Change Management: Portfolio Management Office
Global: Colleagues in other McDonald’s markets and those working in global and segment functions such as Enterprise Data Governance, Data Products, Back Office & Data Enablement, Reporting Hub, Data Platform & Architecture and GDW RunOps
Our vendors and suppliers




Qualifications

What background do I need to have?




Essential requirements

Strong technical acumen with a proficiency in relevant technologies and the ability to apply them to solve problems
Strong demonstrated experience in a data related field such as Data Governance, Analytics, Business Intelligence (BI), Data Engineering, Data Operations and Data Product teams
A bachelor's degree in a data-related field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline is preferable. However, equivalent certifications or relevant qualifications in Data & Information Technology will also be considered.
Proficient in a variety of data technology and platforms such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, Talend (ETL), Data Movement, Data Warehousing, Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), and Data Governance and Quality tools
Experience using SQL and Microsoft Office, including Visio, PowerPoint & Excel
Experience writing and implementing business requirements, process maps, user stories
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with meticulous attention to detail
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills with an ability to produce reports, documentation, and communicate with audiences at all levels.
Ability to effectively communicate complex technical issues to non-technical colleagues
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and collaboratively across functional teams
Strong organisational skills with ability to work under pressure, prioritising tasks, and delivering data requests within agreed timelines
Working knowledge of consulting and project management techniques/methods
Dedicated to understanding business needs and achieving results that positively impact business performance
Possesses a strong work ethic and focuses on delivering business outcomes




Some experience of desirable

Experience in Agile methodologies
Background in Retail and Hospitality sector
Experience working in large-scale data transformation initiatives
Familiar with AI technologies




Knowledge of but not essential

Familiar with programming languages such as Python
Service Now
Miro
Smartsheet
Jira & Confluence
Collibra & LightUp




Additional Information

At McDonald’s we are People from all Walks of Life...




People are at the heart of everything we do and they make the McDonald’s experience. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture that means people can be their best authentic self in our restaurants and offices, which helps us to better serve our customers.

We have a strong heritage of diversity and representation within our communities, which we are proud of. The diversity of our people, customers, Franchisees and suppliers give us strength.

We do not tolerate inequality, injustice or discrimination of any kind. These are hugely important issues and a brand with our reach and relevance means we have a very meaningful role to play.

We also recognise our responsibility as a large employer to continue being active in our communities, helping to develop skills and drive aspirations that will help people to be more aware of the world of work and more successful within it, whether with McDonald’s or elsewhere.”

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Location: London (Oval), United Kingdom

Type: Full-time

Reports to: VP of Supply and Operations

Salary: £30,000- £40,000

About us:

Zen is revolutionising education. Schools spend over £2bn a year on agency staff, and £600m of that goes straight into the pockets of recruitment agencies. That’s why we’ve built an alternative.

Our online platform gives schools instant access to hundreds of profiles of fully vetted teachers and support staff. Since launching in 2017, we’ve saved schools over £10m – money that goes straight back into school budgets and increases teachers’ pay.

We are well-funded by high profile investors and are led by start-up veterans behind two of London’s most prominent tech companies.

The role:



You will work closely with the candidate onboarding team to help drive increased automation and efficiency in getting candidates onto the platform.
You will be responsible for building reports and dashboards, reporting on KPIs and ad hoc data analysis.
You will work collaboratively with the school sales, operations and product teams to continuously improve efficiency in delivering value to schools and teachers.
You will report into the VP of Supply and Operations and support on other strategic projects to drive business growth.
Passion for companies that have a positive social impact and the education sector



Who You Are 🙋



You don't just love data, but love understanding the stories the data tells about the business.
Ideally, you have either 1+ year experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in Sales or Operations, or you have recently completed a Data Analytics / Data Science bootcamp.
Good working knowledge of SQL. Proficiency in Excel is a strong plus.
Enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn. You will get support and training but we also want to hear what you think we can do better 🧠
You are able to build meaningful relationships with cross functional teams, and are a strong communicator of insights.
You are passionate about companies that have a positive social impact 🚀



What's in it for you?



Work that you want to talk about
Competitive salary
Ownership in the company
25 days of holiday
Central London office with perks like fresh fruit, yoga classes, bike parking, showers and an on-site gym and café
Fun-loving, tight-knit team solving a problem that makes a difference
1-1 coaching
Life Insurance
Health Insurance
Electric Car Scheme
Cycle to Work Scheme



We can’t wait to hear from you!

Diversity and Inclusion

At Zen, we strive to build a culture of equity and inclusion, where everyone is respected, valued and appreciated for their unique traits, experiences and perspectives. We are committed to creating a safe, inclusive and equitable environment where our team can thrive, regardless of age, ethnicity, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, disability, religion or beliefs. We value our differences and believe that practices of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion help us create a fairer, more compassionate environment for all.

We welcome applicants with diverse backgrounds and different experiences and perspectives — just like the staff who teach through Zen and the children at the schools we work with. We believe in hiring the best people from the widest pool and creating an inclusive culture where people’s voices are heard and all our team can look forward to coming to work.

We are committed to building a team that reflects the diversity of our community and promoting an equitable and inclusive environment for all. We seek out diverse opinions, beliefs, and experiences because they collectively make us stronger; we’ve had former teachers, pilots, fundraisers, engineers, lawyers, marketers, social media experts and more join our team.

Title: Junior BI Analyst – London/Manchester
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Junior BI Analyst – London/Manchester







Junior BI Analyst required for a leading client based in Oxford. My client is currently seeking a Junior BI Analyst to come on board and support the development of the data warehouse to expand the reporting capabilities and integrate new data sources. You will be responsible for delivering end-to-end reporting solutions to stakeholders and will receive guidance and support from the team.




Hybrid working available at either London, Leeds, Oxford or Manchester Office




The salary for this role is £30,000 - £35,000 per annum




Key responsibilities:

Staging & shaping data from multiple data sources into reporting and analytical solutions and integrations
Developing and maintaining analytics solutions and perform data analysis
Understand data warehouse modelling and different approaches to take
Expanding our data warehouse, incorporating new data sources, and building in best-practice warehouse design
Creation of technical documentation, capturing development, processes & DW changes
Working closely with the IT department to ensure that the data collection and storage are appropriate and suitable for BI purposes
Troubleshooting and resolving data-related problems
Collaborating with colleagues in the Data and Analytics team to deliver dashboard reports
Engaging with clients (usually but not limited to internal colleagues) to understand their needs, and designing and creating a suitable dashboard report
Identifying and suggesting improvements in delivery of BI to the company
Working with all internal departments to identify suitable metrics specific to their departmental operations and wider BI requests
Identifying new sources of data to be used to grow BI capability
Identifying new uses of existing data to provide insight to the company




Key skills:

Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge and experience in Data Warehouse Schema design, data modelling and data warehouse systems (preferably Snowflake, but not essential)
Practical experience with ETL processes and tools




Interested? Please submit your updated CV to Emma Siwicki at Crimson for immediate consideration.

Not interested? Do you know someone who might be a perfect fit for this role? Refer a friend and earn £250 worth of vouchers! Crimson is acting as an employment agency regarding this vacancy

Not interested? Do you know someone who might be a perfect fit for this role? Refer a friend and earn £250 worth of vouchers! Crimson is acting as an employment agency regarding this vacancy

Location: Remote

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.




Key Skills and Experience:

Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with HR platforms like Workday, SAP, Oracle, Ceridian is a plus.

Analyze business processes and identify improvement opportunities.
Translate requirements into practical solutions with the project team.
Support the implementation and address any challenges.
Ensure alignment of shared services with project goals.
Continuously identify and implement improvements.

Data Analyst

£400-450/day inside IR35

3-month contract

Public Sector: Local Authority

London Hybrid

Please note: This role requires recent Public Sector experience. Only apply if you meet this essential need.

Are you a skilled Data Analyst with a passion for making a difference? We have an exciting opportunity for a 3-month contract role with a London Local Authority. As part of their dynamic team, you'll play a crucial role in analysing sensitive data related to a critical programme.

Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive data analysis, drawing insights and trends from complex datasets.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver actionable recommendations.
Handle confidential information with utmost maturity and ethical judgement.

Strong proficiency in tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to navigate intricate matters and maintain professionalism under pressure.
Ethical awareness and discretion when handling sensitive data.

Why Join Us?

Make a meaningful impact on critical programmes affecting our community.
Collaborate with a diverse team of professionals.
Gain valuable experience within a local government setting.

If you're ready to contribute your expertise and work on a very serious and impactful programme, apply now! 🌟

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you seeking a new challenge in a dynamic and impactful organization? The Behavioural Insights Team (BIT) is looking for a passionate individual to support data-driven business decisions and operational excellence. This role involves explaining the story behind the numbers and working with various stakeholders to drive commercial performance, aligning with BIT’s social impact aims and continuous improvement.




About BIT:

The Behavioural Insights Team is a social purpose company that collaborates with governments, businesses, and charities to address major policy issues through simple yet powerful changes. With 250 staff across 8 countries, BIT has completed over 1000 projects, including 700 randomized controlled trials, to improve lives and communities. Acquired by Nesta in 2021, BIT continues to share expertise and build capacity in applying behavioural science for social good




Role and Responsibilities:

This newly created role is in BIT’s Data team, reporting to the Head of Data Visualisation to support the day-to-day business running of Power BI and the improvement of efficiencies in the business. You will play a crucial role in monitoring data quality, correcting data issues, and supporting the finance team with month-end reporting.




Key responsibilities include:

Data Quality and Maintenance: Monitor reports for data quality, correct data issues, and ensure the main data system is current. Become an expert in using the system and advise users across the business.
Data Integration and Visualization: Use Power BI to connect to various data sources, manipulate data, and display it in an easily digestible format. Perform statistical analysis of data and create understandable reports and visualizations.
Ad-Hoc Data Requests: Handle ad-hoc data requests from around the business, providing support with exports from Power BI or other data systems.
Support Finance Team: Assist with the budgeting process for the finance team using G-Sheets and Power BI, and support month-end reporting by reconciling data between sources.
Stakeholder Engagement: Liaise with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements for reporting, and work to deliver these reports.




Skills and Experience:

Data Analysis: Strong interest in and passion for data analysis. Proficiency in using tools such as Excel/Google Sheets for data extraction and analysis. Extensive experience with Power BI, including connecting to data sources, manipulating data, and creating visualizations.
Process Improvement: Ability to analyze, prioritize, and redesign business processes to simplify, automate, and reduce workload—experience in planning, implementing, and communicating changes effectively.
Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
Time Management: Proven ability to manage deadlines and priorities to produce high-quality work within reasonable timeframes.
Teamwork: Although this role will be mainly independent, experience in collaborating with team members and providing support to ensure successful project outcomes. Ability to manage workload effectively and care about the success and well-being of others.
Ability to work independently: Ability to carry out all the above skills independently as this will be a self-sufficient role.




Qualifications:

A bachelor's degree (or equivalent qualification) in a relevant field, such as Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or a related discipline.
1-3 years of experience in a data analyst role, focusing on using Power BI (with both M-Query and DAX) for data visualization and analysis.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Have:

Experience working with overseas subsidiaries.
Experience in professional services or consultancy businesses.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the world’s leading luxury department stores and we’re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world’s most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we’ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, you’ll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days’ holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Sweaty Betty, we’re more than just a global activewear and lifestyle brand for women.

We’re also a community that believes fitness is a flip-the-switch trigger for becoming the woman you want to be. Leggings and sports bras won’t change the world on their own. But with a grab-my-hand, let’s-go-for-it-now spirit, the women who wear them can.




If you want to join us on the next chapter of our adventure, you’re in the right place. This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to join us on our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond.




SB Values:

∙ We Really Care ∙ First, Best, Bravest ∙ Our Strength is in Each Other ∙ Stand Up, Speak Up, Shout Out




Your primary purpose is to lead complex data analysis projects, transforming intricate datasets into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and operational excellence. Through advanced analytics and compelling data storytelling, you'll collaborate across functions to deliver impactful business outcomes. Your role is pivotal in fostering a culture of experimentation and agile analytics practices that consistently deliver timely insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Partner with key stakeholders to define crucial metrics, create engaging data narratives and shape strategic direction.
Apply advanced analytical techniques to uncover trends and patterns, delivering actionable insights through compelling storytelling to guide business decisions.
Collaborate with the data team & subject matter experts to develop, build and deliver impactful data products
Create and maintain high-quality Power BI dashboards that clearly communicate KPIs and guide decision-making.
Collaborate with other analysts to foster a thriving analytics community and champion an agile, experimental approach to analytical challenges




Must Haves

Able to translate complex data into compelling stories for diverse audiences, including leadership.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and statistical analysis methods (e.g., Regression, Classification). Python is a bonus
Project management skills: experience in managing multiple stakeholders and end-to-end projects




The Extras

Generous clothing allowance
60% off all Sweaty Betty merchandise
25 days holiday, plus 8 flexible bank holidays
Sample sales
10 days work from anywhere policy
Company bonus scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Health Cash Plan benefit with Medicash available to all Sweaty Betty UK Employees
Enhanced Family Leave policy
Discounts at the best Studio Classes
SB Flexible Working: we currently work flexibly between the office and home




Our D&I Commitment

Our mission is to empower all women. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary to become an inclusive, diverse and actively anti-racist company. We care about our people, our community, our world. And we want to stand up for what we believe in.

We want to give our people a platform to use their voice. And actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development and progression across the business. Training our leaders, managers and teams about their rights under our equality, diversity and inclusion policy. And being clear on the responsibilities we hold to each other and our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs. And work harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.

Ultimately, we’re working to create a culture and team that represents our customers, our community and our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity and the power it gives our team and our business.

We know we’re on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren’t up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn’t be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our Internal Diversity & Inclusion Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say All, we mean it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years’ worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.


What We're Looking For In Our Applicants


Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits


Competitive holiday allowance
Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
Flexible working patterns
Workplace Pension Scheme
Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Referral Bonus Scheme
Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)
Show more
